Mary Wolcott of Windsor CT

2nd daughter of Henry and Elizabeth Wolcott of Windsor CT.

Revised January 2026
These web pages are intended for genealogical research purposes only and may not be used elsewhere without permission, but linking is allowed without need of approval. Questions and additions or corrections may be sent to Eric Wolcott, (ewolcott6 at gmail.com).
(1) Mary Wolcott1, b. ABT 1622 Tolland, Somerset, England, d. 16 SEP 1689 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesMARY came to America with her sister and younger brother about 1635. She and her husband died the same day.
m. 25 JUN 1646 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Job Drake, b. 1619 Wiscombe, Devonshire, England, d. 16 SEP 1689 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesJOB came to America in 1630 with his family on the "Winslow Fleet". He and his wife died on the same day of a disease that caused many deaths at Windsor in 1689 including two of his brothers, one sister in law, and one brother-in-law. His will said "I leave unto my wife the use of my dwelling house & barn. orchard & homelot except that which I give unto my son, Job, with my pasture I bought of Goodman Bissell, the land in the Little Meadow & the 10 acres of land I had of my brother, Christopher, & the inclosed lands...unto my son Job 6 acres of land that I had of my father Drake...my dwelling house, barn orchard and homelot with all my land within the township of Windsor...provided that he record to his son Job that house and that part of the homelott which he now enjoyeth...at 21 years of age...to my daughter Elizabeth the 4 acres of land in the Great Meadow that I bought of Goodman Thrall at my wife's decease. I give to Ephraim Colton 40 shillings and small rapier. I have given to my grchild Israel Dewey 2 young steers as also a chest marked E. D. To my grchild Susanna Packer my land at Greenfield.... I give to Joseph Dewey L4.... I give to my Grandchild Mary Drake that which is due me from my Father Drake's estate also from my brother Joseph's estate, also L4. I give to my grson Joseph Dewey land over the river...which was my father Drake's I give to my grchild Job Colton L5...and a gun. I give to Elizabeth my son Job's wife 50 shillings...the remainder of my estate to be divided amongst my children, that is to Job, Abigail, Elizabeth, and Esther...my son Job Drake to be sole Executor...." SOURCE CITATION: Title: Colonial Families of the United States Source Comments: NS16043
7 children: Abigail, Mary, Job, Elizabeth, Joseph, Hepzibah, Hester "Esther".
(2) Abigail Drake2 (Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 SEP 1648 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 NOV 1696 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 20 AUG 1668 Northampton, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, Israel Dewey, b. 25 SEP 1645 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 OCT 1678 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: Hannah, Israel, David, Joseph.
(3) Hannah Dewey3 (Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1680 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. .
m. 1704 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Philip Loomis, b. 22 FEB 1675 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1 DEC 1746 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
12 children: Hannah, Philip, Joel, Elizabeth, Abigail, Mary, Jerusha, Timothy, Margaret, Sarah, Ruth, Prudence.
(4) Hannah Loomis4 (Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 MAY 1705 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. ,, Connecticut.
m. 25 JUN 1730 ,, Connecticut, Azariah Holcomb, b. 1707 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1771 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
10 children: Benjamin, Abner, Elizabeth, Eldad, Obed, Hannah, Bethia, Mary, Lois, Eunice.
(5) Benjamin Holcomb5 (Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 MAR 1746 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Elizabethtown, Herkimer Co., New York.
m. Mercy Kendall, b. 18 JAN 1748 Woburn, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts, d. .
1 children: Mehitable.

(6) Philetus Cooley6 (Lois Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 MAY 1773 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .

(7) Jefferson Cooley7 (Philetus Cooley6, Lois Holcomb5, Hannah Loomis4, Hannah Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 SEP 1800 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 DEC 1840 Granby, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesJEFFERSON graduated from Yale University and taught school at Granby. He studied law under Jared Griswold of Hartford. In 1836 he became Preceptor of the Poughkeepsie Academy. He was made Principal of the Academy at Sharon, Connecticut, in 1837.

(6) David Dewey6 (David Dewey5, Jabez Dewey4, Israel Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAR 1746 Stonington, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 1 MAY 1839 Plainfield, Otsego Co., New York.
NotesDAVID served as a Pvt. in the Connecticut Militia, 1776-1777 and as a Pvt. in the Rhode Island Militia in 1779.
m. 12 JAN 1768 Hopkinton, Washington Co., Rhode Island, Sarah Witter, b. 1743 , d. 13 FEB 1804 .
1 children: Sarah.
(7) Sarah Dewey7 (David Dewey6, David Dewey5, Jabez Dewey4, Israel Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1770 , d. 25 OCT 1806 .
m. 8 NOV 1786 Leyden, Franklin Co., Massachusetts, John Cunnabell, b. 1749 Bernardstown, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 26 AUG 1813 Bernardstown, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesJohn served in the Revolutionary War in 1775, 1777 and 1779. He was a private until 1779 when he was chosen Chairman of the Committee of Safety and Correspondence in 1779.

(3) David Dewey3 (Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 JAN 1676 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 NOV 1712 Westfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesDAVID was a weaver. He was a member of the Westfield church for 12 years, and was made a deacon in 1712. Several of his spiritual writing were published in a commemerative pamphlet after his death.

(5) Abigail Dewey5 (Charles Dewey4, David Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .

(5) Joseph Dewey5 (Charles Dewey4, David Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 MAY 1735 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 1778 , Columbia Co., New York.
m. 29 JAN 1756 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, Deborah Buell, b. 13 SEP 1735 Marlborough, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 JAN 1813 .
11 children: Deborah, Joseph, Mary, Lydia, Anna, Jerusha, Elias, Chester, Sully, Hannah, Marcia.
(6) Deborah Dewey6 (Joseph Dewey5, Charles Dewey4, David Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 AUG 1756 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. APR 1837 Ashtabula, Ashtabula Co., Ohio.
NotesDEBORAH and her husband moved from Lebanon, Connecticut, to Columbia Co., New York, and then Delhi, Delaware Co., New York, in 1776, where eight of their nine children were born and raised. Her husband died from being thrown by a horse, when a spring-lance he carried in his pocket pierced his side. In 1802, Deborah took her four youngest children by ox drawn wagon to Ohio where her son, Abraham, and his wife had settled in 1801. They settled in a log cabin at what is now Austinburg, Ohio, with Indian neighbors. Her biography was printed in the 1915 Wolcott Society annual report.
m. DEC 1774 Hebron, Tolland Co., Connecticut, George Webster, b. Of Lebanon, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 1800 , Delaware Co., New York.
9 children: Cynthia, Abraham, Persis, Wealthy, Belinda, George, Polly, Philo, Lewis.
(7) Cynthia Webster7 (Deborah Dewey6, Joseph Dewey5, Charles Dewey4, David Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
(7) Abraham Webster7 (Deborah Dewey6, Joseph Dewey5, Charles Dewey4, David Dewey3, Abigail Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
NotesABRAHAM came to Ohio in 1801, and settled at Geneva, Ohio.

NotesPHILO's mother raised his children after his wife died. His mother continued living in his home after he remarried.

(5) Esther Hoar5 (Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 APR 1742 Brimfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 13 MAY 1818 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
m. 23 JUL 1768 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Simeon Keep, b. 27 FEB 1737 Brimfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 22 JUL 1829 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesSIMEON was a Lieutenant in Capt. James Sherman's Co., Col. Ebenezer Larned's Regt., Massachusetts militia, and in Capt. Reuben Munn's Co., 1st Regt., Hampshire County militia. He was in Capt. Aaron Charles' Co., Lt. Col. Timothy Robinson's Regt., Hampshire Co., militia at Ticonderoga, 24 February 1777. He lived in the part of Brimfield which later became Monson.
9 children: Seth, Simeon, Roxana, Abigail, Esther, Lettice, Joseph, Ethan, Warham.
(6) Seth Keep6 (Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 MAY 1771 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 JUN 1857 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
NotesSeth removed to Vermont, after marriage, and in 1801 moved to Homer, New York. He was a farmer, as were all his sons. He was for many years a member of the Congregational church.
m. 23 JAN 1798 Lovisa Hitchcock, b. 24 MAY 1772 Brimfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 10 NOV 1855 Homer, Cortland Co., New York.
7 children: Asa, Timothy, Esther, Loren, Alvira, Fidelia, Simeon Burt,

(8) Sarah Eliza Keep8 (Ethan Keep7, Simeon Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 APR 1831 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. .
m. 1 MAY 1855 Nathan Pond, b. 27 APR 1829 Oakham, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. .
(8) Edward Purington Keep8 (Ethan Keep7, Simeon Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 JUN 1833 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 1900 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesEDWARD and his sister, Mary, were raised by his aunt and uncle, Limira Keep Chapin and Marcus Chapin. He and Mary were the heirs of Marcus, whose children predeceased him. He was given Marcus' 100 acre dairy farm. Edward donated $40,000 to obtain the Tiffany glass windows for the First Congregational Church in Monson, Massachusetts, where he was a deacon.
m. 30 NOV 1858 Mary E. Grout, b. , d. .
(8) Mary Almira Keep8 (Ethan Keep7, Simeon Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1835 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 FEB 1852 .
(7) Ethan Keep7 (Simeon Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 OCT 1802 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 21 JAN 1851 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesETHAN was a farmer at Monson, Massachusetts.
m. Lydia Hubbard, b. , d. .
(7) Lamira Goodell Keep7 (Simeon Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 JAN 1805 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 15 NOV 1873 .
NotesLAMIRA and her husband purchased a home in 1854. It became a dairy farm, and had several small rock quarries. In 1856, Marcus conveyed the home to his nephew, Edward Keep, as his own children had all predeceased him. Marcus' estate was divided between his nephew and neice, Edward and Mary Keep, who he had raised. The home is now the Keep Homestead Museum.
m. 20 JAN 1830 Marcus Chapin, b. , d. .
1 children: Jane Elizabeth.

NotesCHARLES was mustered in as Corporal of Company E, 36th Massachusetts Regiment, 17 July 1862 and died of dysentery at Crab Orchard, Kentucky during the Civil War.

NotesWAIT was a Corporal in the Union Army and was killed at the BATTLE OF GETTYSBURG.

m. 1804 David Wood, b. 5 FEB 1765 Monson, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 7 SEP 1851 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York.
Spouse NotesDAVID's father served with his father-in-law in Reuben Munn's Company. David was a farmer at Winfield, New York.
7 children: Persis, Hiram, Leander, Alonzo, Jackson, Abigail, Simeon.
(7) Persis Wood7 (Abigail Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 MAY 1805 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 22 JUN 1890 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York.
m. 1822 William King, b. 9 NOV 1796 Pawlet, Rutland Co., Vermont, d. 3 SEP 1868 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York.
Spouse NotesWilliam was a Captain in the Calvary. He was a teamster, hauling freight between Albany and Buffalo, New York until the Erie Canal put him out of business.
11 children: Parmelia, William, Esther, Walter C., David Wood, Alonzo W., Almira, Chauncy, Henry H., Franklin, Harriet C..
(8) Parmelia King8 (Persis Wood7, Abigail Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 JAN 1823 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 22 JUN 1906 Hudran,, Massachusetts.
NotesHer name may have been Parmille or Pamela.
m. Samuel Cummings, b. , d. .
(8) William King8 (Persis Wood7, Abigail Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 SEP 1824 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 4 FEB 1913 .
m. Katherine Harrison, b. , d. .
(8) Esther King8 (Persis Wood7, Abigail Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 SEP 1826 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 22 AUG 1907 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York.
m. 14 JUL 1847 Ephraim Parker, b. , d. .
(8) Walter C. King8 (Persis Wood7, Abigail Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 AUG 1828 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 11 AUG 1905 Grand Island, Hall Co., Nebraska.
m. 12 SEP 1863 Margaret Elizabeth Range, b. , d. .
(8) David Wood King8 (Persis Wood7, Abigail Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 AUG 1830 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 26 JAN 1921 Algona, Kossuth Co., Iowa.
NotesDAVID picked corn for Dr. Brooks in Des Moines, Iowa, in the fall of 1854. He then drove a yoke of oxen from Des Moines to Algona, Iowa, for Ambrose Call. He was one of the first settlers in Kossuth Co., Iowa, a farmer and railroad worker. He was on the members of the first Board of Supervisors for Kossuth Co.
m. 6 DEC 1860 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, Anne Lydia "Lyddie" Hall, b. 10 AUG 1834 New York Mills, Oneida Co., New York, d. 16 SEP 1926 Algona, Kossuth Co., Iowa.
(8) Alonzo W. King8 (Persis Wood7, Abigail Keep6, Esther Hoar5, Deborah Colton4, Ephraim Colton3, Mary Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 MAY 1833 West Winfield, Herkimer Co., New York, d. 15 NOV 1920 .
m. Harriett Beebe, b. , d. .

Spouse NotesMOSES enlisted 25 June 1779 as a Private in Capt. Joshua L.Woodbridge's Company, Col. Natha Tyler's Regt., and served until 25 December 1779. This company served in Rhode Island. Moses and his wife, Marah, were 1st cousins,

m. Anna , b. , d. .
(3) Sarah Drake3 (Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 MAY 1686 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 JAN 1747 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 3 DEC 1702 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Roger Wolcott, b. 4 JAN 1679 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 MAY 1767 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesROGER said that he never attended school in his life, but was taught at home by his mother. At the age of 12 he was apprenticed to a weaver. On reaching adulthood he educated himself by reading, and was admitted to the Bar. He built a home at East Windsor in 1704. Roger was chosen a Selectman of Windsor in 1707, a Representative to the Connecticut General Assembly in 1709, and a member of the Bench of Justices in 1710. He was in charge of the Connecticut commissary supplies in an expedition to Canada in 1711, during Queen Anne's War. In 1714 he was appointed to the Governor's Council. In 1724 he was appointed Judge of the County Court and in 1732 Judge of the Superior Court. He built a ferry across the Connecticut River in 1735, which he sold to the town of Windsor in 1736. In 1741 he became Deputy Governor and Chief Justice of the Connecticut Supreme Court. He was presiding judge in a trial at Winham, where Betty Shaw was convicted of infanticide and hung. Roger was appointed Major General, in command of the Connecticut troops that were part of the expeditions to Cape Breton and the siege of Louisburg in 1745. He was second in command under Sir William Pepperill. In 1750 he was elected Governor of Connecticut, serving until 1754. Roger fell from public favor due to a Spanish merchant's claim for damages when his ship was detained, for which the Assembly blamed the Governor, and so he was defeated for re-election. Roger was granted the right to operate a ferry boat on the Connecticut River near South Windsor. It is said that he became wealthy through land speculation. In 1720, he and seven others purchased 10,000 acres of land in Vermont from the Colony of Connecticut. They sold this land to settlers. While he was Governor, he was accused of encouraging the Susquehanna Company, a group of Connecticut investors who sold to settlers land in Northern Pennsylvania that Connecticut and Pennsylvania both claimed. Roger's son, Oliver, was a member of this company. It was later determined that neither Connecticut or the Susquehanna Company had a legal right to this land. Roger retired from public life, retiring to farming and literary pursuits. He published at least three of his writings, one being "Poetical Meditations, Being the Improvement of Some Vacant Hours", printed in 1725, said to have been the first book of poetry printed in the colonies. The second was an ecclesiastical tract about the history and liberties of the Congregational church, printed in 1761. The third was "A Letter to the Freemen of Connecticut", which appeared in the "Connecticut Gazette" in 1761. A pair of silver cups he presented to the Congregational Church at East Windsor have "R W 1756 engraved on them. His estate was valued at 1,805L. Among the bequests in his will were a silver tankard and cup left to his sons Erastus and Oliver Wolcott. Erastus bequeathed the tankard to his son, Erastus. They have the arms of the Shropshire family of Walcott engraved on them. Samuel Wolcott, the author of "The Wolcott Memorial", had the tankard in his possession in 1879. Roger's will also left land at Tolland, Connecticut, and a seal, ring, and a gun to his son, Alexander; land at Podunk, a silver sword, gold buttons, and a gun to his son, Josiah; his home at Windsor and a ferry boat to his son, Erastus; land at Litchfield, Hartford, Colebrook, and Wimdsor and a cannister to his son, Oliver; land at Windsor to be divided between his sons, Alexander, Erastus and Oliver; a watch to his son, Alexander; land at Windsor and Podunk to his grandsons, Roger and Epaphras; 130L to his grandson, Parmenio; land at Windsor, Bolton, and Wellington to his daughter, Maryanne; 15L to his daughter, Ursula; and the balance to be divided among his children. Gravestone reads: "Here lyeth the body of the Hon. Roger Wolcott, Esq., of Windsor, who for serveal years was Governor of the Colony of Connecticut died May 17th, Anno tatis 89, Salutis 1767. Births highest station end in here he lies And dust to dust coneludes her noblest song."
15 children: Roger, Elizabeth, Alexander, Samuel, Alexander, Sarah, Sarah, Hepzibah, Josiah, Erastus, Epaphras, Erastus, Ursula, Oliver, Mariann.
(4) Roger Wolcott4 (Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 SEP 1704 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 10 OCT 1759 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER lived in South Windsor, his property adjoining that of his uncle, Henry. He was a Representative for Windsor at the General Assembly, a Major in the Connecticut militia, a member of the Council, and Judge of the Hartford County Court and the Superior Court of Connecticut. Roger was one of those appointed to revise the laws of the Connecticut Colony, and was one of three commissioners appointed by the Colony of Connecticut to meet at Albany in 1745 with representatives of other colonies, to discuss a plan for union. He was one of the subscribers to the Susquehanna Land Company in 1753.
m. 10 OCT 1728 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Mary "Mara" Newberry, b. 3 FEB 1710 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JUN 1758 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
11 children: Roger, Marah, Roger, Sarah, Roger, Epaphras, Mary, Emeline, Parmenio, Amelia, Martha.
(5) Roger Wolcott5 (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 SEP 1729 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 15 NOV 1729 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(5) Marah Wolcott5 (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 OCT 1730 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 AUG 1737 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(5) Roger Wolcott5 (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 JUN 1733 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 NOV 1736 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(5) Sarah Wolcott5 (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 JUN 1735 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 APR 1812 .
m. 26 APR 1758 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Elisha Steele, b. 7 OCT 1728 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 17 AUG 1773 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesELISHA graduated from Yale College in 1750, and was the first lawyer in Tolland, Connecticut. He was a justice of the peace and elected to the state legislature six times. His marriage was also recorded at Tolland.
6 children: Sarah, Mary, Mary Ann, Elisha, Roger, Mehitable.
(6) Sarah Steele6 (Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 APR 1759 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 15 JUL 1790 .
m. 9 DEC 1779 Justus Reed, b. 17 OCT 1760 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. OCT 1864 .
1 children: Sarah.
(7) Sarah Reed7 (Sarah Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 OCT 1785 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 MAR 1846 .
m. Phineas Blodgett, b. 2 NOV 1783 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 APR 1842 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
5 children: Sarah Maria "Mary", Elizabeth May, Abigail Reed, Phineas Lafayette, Lavellette Clayton,
(8) Sarah Maria "Mary" Blodgett8 (Sarah Reed7, Sarah Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 MAY 1810 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 JUN 1897 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.

m. 30 JUN 1844 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Lucy Ann Allen, b. , d. .
(8) Lavellette Clayton Blodgett8 (Sarah Reed7, Sarah Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 JUL 1821 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 SEP 1904 .
m. 4 OCT 1847 Mary Ann Ladd, b. , d. 4 OCT 1858 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(8) Lavellette Clayton Blodgett8 (Sarah Reed7, Sarah Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 JUL 1821 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 SEP 1904 .
m. MAY 1860 Loraine Bradish, b. , d. 29 MAY 1891 .
(6) Mary Steele6 (Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 MAY 1761 , d. .
(6) Mary Ann Steele6 (Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 APR 1763 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 26 OCT 1853 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
m. ABT 1782 Roger Wolcott, b. 25 MAY 1760 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 19 DEC 1799 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesROGER was at East Windsor in 1790 with 2 males over 16, 1 male under 16, 2 females, and 1 free Negro. His widow and her three daughters moved from Bridgewater, Connecticut, to Evans Mills, New York, after his death. The widow and her unmarried daughter, Polly, lived with her daughter, Sarah Wolcott Rogers, at LeRoy, New York.
9 children: , Mary Ann "Mariann", Mehitable, Mehitable, Oliver, Mary, Martha Burnham, Sarah Steele "Sally", Mary "Polly".
(7) Wolcott7 (Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 APR 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7 (Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 NOV 1784 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 16 NOV 1858 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
m. 12 NOV 1801 Warren Samuel Stuart, b. 14 NOV 1781 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 FEB 1828 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
Spouse NotesWARREN was in the 1985 Wolcott genealogy book as Samuel Warren Stuart.
9 children: Esther, Maria, Amelia, Adaline, Elisha S., Martha, Roger Wolcott, William Henry, Samuel Mott.
(8) Esther Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 OCT 1802 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 18 DEC 1889 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
m. 13 JUN 1822 Asahel "Asel" Rogers, b. 1 APR 1800 Bridgewater, Oneida Co., New York, d. 26 MAY 1884 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
Spouse NotesASEL Rogers was a farmer at Philadelphia, New York, in 1850, with all his know children living with him. Asahel was a farmer at Philadelphia, New York, in 1880, with wife Esther, living next door to Charles Rogers.
(8) Maria Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 DEC 1804 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 25 DEC 1885 .
m. 23 JUN 1833 Charles A. Haviland, b. ABT 1809 ,, New York, d. .
Spouse NotesCHARLES is found in the Hamburg, Erie Co., New York 1850 census: Charles A. Haveland, 41, clothier: Maieah, 47, Charles E., 14; Sarah E., 6; and Mariam Stuart, 64 born in Connecticut. The others all born in New York. This census taken 4 August 1850. Living next door is her brother Elisha and family. There is also a Charles A. Haviland, 40 born in New York in the Butte Co., Californian 1850 censes. He is a miner. This census taken 23 Sept 1850. Did he try to strike it rich as many other did? He is found in the Hamburg, Erie Co., New York 1860 census: Charles A. Haviland, 50; Mariah, 53 and Amelia 16. All born in New York. They are found in the Bangor, Bay Co., Michigan 1870 census: Haviland, Chas, 58, clerk in store; Maria, 56. They are living with their daughters family: Cadwell, William, 34, Amelia, 24, and Annie, 1. All born in New York but William, born in Michigan. The are found in the Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois 1880 census still living with their daughters family: Cadwell, William H., 43, retail grocer born in Michigan; Amelia, 36, NY; Annie, 10, NY; Lillian, 9, MI; Haviland, Charles A., father, 71, NY; and Maria, mother, 73, NY.
(8) Amelia Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 FEB 1807 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 DEC 1887 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
m. 5 NOV 1829 Marvin Cadwell, b. 9 SEP 1800 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 27 OCT 1860 .
Spouse NotesMARVIN is found in the Webster, Washtenaw Co. Michigan 1850 census: Marvin Cadwell, 50, farmer born in Connecticut; Amelia, 43, NY; Marvin, 20, NY; Jason, 18, MI; Charles, 16, MI; William, 14, MI; Emeline, 12, MI; Mary Ann, 8, MI; Geo W., 6, MI; and Warren, 3, MI. They are still there in the 1860 census: Marvin Cadwell, 59, farmer born in Connecticut; Amelia, 54, NY; George 16, MI; Warren, 14, MI and Ella, 10, MI. Living next to them is their son Jason, 28, MI and with wife Elen, 21, NY.
(8) Adaline Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1809 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 MAR 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesADELINE Haviland purchased land at Washtenaw Co., Michigan, in 1837.
m. 21 JUL 1829 Russell Cadwell, b. ABT 1802 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(8) Adaline Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1809 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 MAR 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesADELINE Haviland purchased land at Washtenaw Co., Michigan, in 1837.
m. 1835 Lewis Jay Haviland, b. 1807 ,, New York, d. 4 JAN 1893 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
Spouse NotesLEWIS was at Iosco Township, Michigan, in 1850. He was a farmer at Iosco, Michigan, in 1880, with Adeline and Samuel E. Haviland. L. J. and Jacob Haviland were land owners at Iosco in 1844, and Charles A. Haviland in 1848. Delos M. Haviland, 20, of Iosco and Lewis A Haviland , 24, of Livingston Co., Michigan, enlisted in Co. K, 4th Michigan Inf. Regt., in the Civil War. L. J. and W. H. Haviland had land at Iosco in 1875.
(8) Elisha S. Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 JUN 1812 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 14 AUG 1855 Water Valley, Erie Co., New York.
m. MAR 1833 Minerva Hunn, b. 1814 , d. 30 JUN 1901 .
(8) Martha Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUN 1814 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 17 FEB 1815 , Jefferson Co., New York.
(8) Roger Wolcott Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 MAR 1818 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 5 JAN 1847 .
m. 15 JAN 1845 Lorinda Prenille, b. , d. .
(8) William Henry Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.
m. 27 JAN 1842 Lyme, Jefferson Co., New York, Barbara Allen, b. 2 OCT 1822 , d. 14 SEP 1861 .
(8) William Henry Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.
m. 1 JUL 1863 Jane Popple, b. , d. .

m. 16 JUL 1842 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York, Mary Jane Redfield, b. 17 OCT 1824 Malta, Saratoga Co., New York, d. 5 AUG 1904 Hamburg, Erie Co., New York.

m. Daniel Converse, b. 17 SEP 1791 , d. 2 MAR 1873 Crittenden, Erie Co., New York.
Spouse NotesDANIEL was a farmer. He moved to Erie Co., New York, about 1836, and to Chili, New York, about 1840. About 1860, he sold his farm and returned to Jefferson Co., New York.
10 children: Sally Wolcott, Sally Wolcott, Mary Mariah, Cyrus Steele, Lucy Ann, David Elliott, Daniel Evander, Lucy Jane, Roger Wolcott, Willard.

(8) Lucy Jane Converse8 (Martha Burnham Wolcott7, Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 JAN 1829 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York, d. .
m. 3 JUL 1846 Chili, Monroe Co., New York, Henry Wedd, b. 15 SEP 1821 Latchingdon, Essex Co., England, d. .
Spouse NotesHENRY was a farmer. He moved his family to Kansas City, Missouri in 1858. In 1863 he bought 160 acres of land from the Indians, 16 miles from Kansas City. He later owned 660 acres.

NotesWILLARD was killed in the Civil War.

(7) Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott7 (Mary Ann Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1796 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 JAN 1892 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
m. ABT 1818 William Rogers, b. 1795 , d. 24 APR 1875 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
Spouse NotesWILLIAM and his wife, Sarah, came to Evans Mills and owned 500 acres on which they built a stone house that was still standing in 1953.
6 children: Mayette, Sally Ann, Martha, Jesse, Wolcott Alexander, Milissa.

NotesPOLLY and her mother came to live with her sister, Sarah Rogers, at Evans Mills, and both died there and are both buried in the Rogers plot there.

(8) John Davis Ellis8 (Almira Steele7, Elisha Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 MAY 1834 LeRoy, Genesee Co., New York, d. 4 MAY 1898 Dansville, Livingston Co., New York.

m. SEP 1862 Albert Hoyt, b. 3 NOV 1836 ,, New York, d. .
Spouse NotesALBERT was a bank cashier at Antwerp, New York, in 1880.
(7) Wolcott Steele7 (Elisha Steele6, Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1809 , d. 18 AUG 1878 .
NotesWOLCOTT was a farmer at Alexandria, New York, with 9 cows and 50 acres off land.
(6) Roger Steele6 (Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 JUN 1768 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. .
(6) Mehitable Steele6 (Sarah Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. MAY 1770 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 20 AUG 1812 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut.
(5) Sarah Wolcott5 (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 JUN 1735 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 APR 1812 .
m. AFT 1773 Elijah Chapman, b. , d. .
(5) Roger Wolcott5 (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 NOV 1737 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 JAN 1798 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER marched to Boston at the Lexington alarm as an Ensign and standard bearer in Capt. Amasa Loomis' Co.. He was a member of the Executive Committee of the Susquahanna Company, a land developmeny company formed to market land in the Wyoming Valley of Pennsylvania. In 1790 his family consisted of 2 males over 16, 1 male under 16, 3 females, and 1 free Negro at East Windsor, Connecticut.
m. ABT 1755 Dorcas Burnham, b. 15 MAY 1737 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 NOV 1823 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
13 children: Martha, Roger, Abner, Jemima, Cornelius, Hannah, Abigail, Seth, Amelia, Emelia, Oliver, , Rhoda.
(6) Martha Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 OCT 1757 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 APR 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 1777 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Samuel Treat, b. 6 JUL 1752 Wethersfield, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 APR 1795 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesSAMUEL was a sheriff.
1 children: Martha Wolcott "Patty".
(7) Martha Wolcott "Patty" Treat7 (Martha Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 OCT 1778 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 MAR 1849 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. David McKinney, b. 1 SEP 1779 , d. 6 DEC 1853 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
10 children: Betsey, Samuel Treat, Martha Ann, David Dana, Andrew Mills, Frederick Wolcott "Fred", Edward Denison, William Henry, Jerusha, Maria Louisa.
(8) Betsey McKinney8 (Martha Wolcott "Patty" Treat7, Martha Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 JAN 1800 , d. 12 FEB 1875 .
m. Thomas Heath, b. , d. .

(8) Edward Denison McKinney8 (Martha Wolcott "Patty" Treat7, Martha Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 JUN 1816 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 JUL 1853 .
NotesEDWARD "died from injuries received while in discharge of his duties as conductor on the New York & New Haven Railroad."
(8) William Henry McKinney8 (Martha Wolcott "Patty" Treat7, Martha Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 DEC 1819 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 JUN 1898 .
(8) Jerusha McKinney8 (Martha Wolcott "Patty" Treat7, Martha Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 NOV 1821 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 26 JAN 1853 .
m. 1 JAN 1845 Hosea Douglas, b. 14 NOV 1823 , d. 1884 .
(8) Maria Louisa McKinney8 (Martha Wolcott "Patty" Treat7, Martha Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1823 , d. 1883 .
m. Hosea Douglas, b. 14 NOV 1823 , d. 1884 .
(6) Roger Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 MAY 1760 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 19 DEC 1799 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER was at East Windsor in 1790 with 2 males over 16, 1 male under 16, 2 females, and 1 free Negro. His widow and her three daughters moved from Bridgewater, Connecticut, to Evans Mills, New York, after his death. The widow and her unmarried daughter, Polly, lived with her daughter, Sarah Wolcott Rogers, at LeRoy, New York.
m. ABT 1782 Mary Ann Steele, b. 28 APR 1763 Tolland Township, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 26 OCT 1853 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
9 children: , Mary Ann "Mariann", Mehitable, Mehitable, Oliver, Mary, Martha Burnham, Sarah Steele "Sally", Mary "Polly".
(7) Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 APR 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 NOV 1784 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 16 NOV 1858 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
m. 12 NOV 1801 Warren Samuel Stuart, b. 14 NOV 1781 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 FEB 1828 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
Spouse NotesWARREN was in the 1985 Wolcott genealogy book as Samuel Warren Stuart.
9 children: Esther, Maria, Amelia, Adaline, Elisha S., Martha, Roger Wolcott, William Henry, Samuel Mott.
(8) Esther Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 OCT 1802 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 18 DEC 1889 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
m. 13 JUN 1822 Asahel "Asel" Rogers, b. 1 APR 1800 Bridgewater, Oneida Co., New York, d. 26 MAY 1884 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York.
Spouse NotesASEL Rogers was a farmer at Philadelphia, New York, in 1850, with all his know children living with him. Asahel was a farmer at Philadelphia, New York, in 1880, with wife Esther, living next door to Charles Rogers.
(8) Maria Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 DEC 1804 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 25 DEC 1885 .
m. 23 JUN 1833 Charles A. Haviland, b. ABT 1809 ,, New York, d. .
Spouse NotesCHARLES is found in the Hamburg, Erie Co., New York 1850 census: Charles A. Haveland, 41, clothier: Maieah, 47, Charles E., 14; Sarah E., 6; and Mariam Stuart, 64 born in Connecticut. The others all born in New York. This census taken 4 August 1850. Living next door is her brother Elisha and family. There is also a Charles A. Haviland, 40 born in New York in the Butte Co., Californian 1850 censes. He is a miner. This census taken 23 Sept 1850. Did he try to strike it rich as many other did? He is found in the Hamburg, Erie Co., New York 1860 census: Charles A. Haviland, 50; Mariah, 53 and Amelia 16. All born in New York. They are found in the Bangor, Bay Co., Michigan 1870 census: Haviland, Chas, 58, clerk in store; Maria, 56. They are living with their daughters family: Cadwell, William, 34, Amelia, 24, and Annie, 1. All born in New York but William, born in Michigan. The are found in the Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois 1880 census still living with their daughters family: Cadwell, William H., 43, retail grocer born in Michigan; Amelia, 36, NY; Annie, 10, NY; Lillian, 9, MI; Haviland, Charles A., father, 71, NY; and Maria, mother, 73, NY.
(8) Amelia Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 FEB 1807 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 DEC 1887 Dexter, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
m. 5 NOV 1829 Marvin Cadwell, b. 9 SEP 1800 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 27 OCT 1860 .
Spouse NotesMARVIN is found in the Webster, Washtenaw Co. Michigan 1850 census: Marvin Cadwell, 50, farmer born in Connecticut; Amelia, 43, NY; Marvin, 20, NY; Jason, 18, MI; Charles, 16, MI; William, 14, MI; Emeline, 12, MI; Mary Ann, 8, MI; Geo W., 6, MI; and Warren, 3, MI. They are still there in the 1860 census: Marvin Cadwell, 59, farmer born in Connecticut; Amelia, 54, NY; George 16, MI; Warren, 14, MI and Ella, 10, MI. Living next to them is their son Jason, 28, MI and with wife Elen, 21, NY.
(8) Adaline Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1809 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 MAR 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesADELINE Haviland purchased land at Washtenaw Co., Michigan, in 1837.
m. 21 JUL 1829 Russell Cadwell, b. ABT 1802 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(8) Adaline Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1809 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 MAR 1881 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
NotesADELINE Haviland purchased land at Washtenaw Co., Michigan, in 1837.
m. 1835 Lewis Jay Haviland, b. 1807 ,, New York, d. 4 JAN 1893 Iosco, Livingston Co., Michigan.
Spouse NotesLEWIS was at Iosco Township, Michigan, in 1850. He was a farmer at Iosco, Michigan, in 1880, with Adeline and Samuel E. Haviland. L. J. and Jacob Haviland were land owners at Iosco in 1844, and Charles A. Haviland in 1848. Delos M. Haviland, 20, of Iosco and Lewis A Haviland , 24, of Livingston Co., Michigan, enlisted in Co. K, 4th Michigan Inf. Regt., in the Civil War. L. J. and W. H. Haviland had land at Iosco in 1875.
(8) Elisha S. Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 JUN 1812 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 14 AUG 1855 Water Valley, Erie Co., New York.
m. MAR 1833 Minerva Hunn, b. 1814 , d. 30 JUN 1901 .
(8) Martha Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUN 1814 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 17 FEB 1815 , Jefferson Co., New York.
(8) Roger Wolcott Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 MAR 1818 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 5 JAN 1847 .
m. 15 JAN 1845 Lorinda Prenille, b. , d. .
(8) William Henry Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.
m. 27 JAN 1842 Lyme, Jefferson Co., New York, Barbara Allen, b. 2 OCT 1822 , d. 14 SEP 1861 .
(8) William Henry Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAY 1820 Chaumont, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 30 JUN 1893 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York.
NotesWILLIAM came to Michigan in 1830, but returned to Rochester, New York in 1831 where he worked in a printing office. He went to Michigan again in 1834, and again returned to New York where he worked with his brother, Samuel, operating a woolen manufacturing company in Wheatland, Monroe County, New York. He established a woolen factory in 1863 at Lodi, New York, later called Gowanda. He was Librarian of the New York State Senate in 1865, and was elected to the New York State Assembly in 1869. He was later postmaster at Gowanda. William was a Republican and a Mason, and wrote poetry.
m. 1 JUL 1863 Jane Popple, b. , d. .
(8) Samuel Mott Stuart8 (Mary Ann "Mariann" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 6 OCT 1822 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York, d. 25 OCT 1906 Hamburg, Erie Co., New York.
m. 16 JUL 1842 Gowanda, Cattarauqua Co., New York, Mary Jane Redfield, b. 17 OCT 1824 Malta, Saratoga Co., New York, d. 5 AUG 1904 Hamburg, Erie Co., New York.
(7) Mehitable Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 MAY 1786 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 JUL 1787 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Mehitable Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 MAR 1788 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 AUG 1788 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Oliver Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 MAY 1789 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 22 MAR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Mary Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 MAR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Martha Burnham Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 FEB 1794 New Haven, New Haven Co., Connecticut, d. 13 NOV 1853 Chili, Monroe Co., New York.
m. Daniel Converse, b. 17 SEP 1791 , d. 2 MAR 1873 Crittenden, Erie Co., New York.
Spouse NotesDANIEL was a farmer. He moved to Erie Co., New York, about 1836, and to Chili, New York, about 1840. About 1860, he sold his farm and returned to Jefferson Co., New York.
10 children: Sally Wolcott, Sally Wolcott, Mary Mariah, Cyrus Steele, Lucy Ann, David Elliott, Daniel Evander, Lucy Jane, Roger Wolcott, Willard.
(8) Sally Wolcott Converse8 (Martha Burnham Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 DEC 1812 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 13 DEC 1812 , Jefferson Co., New York.

m. 27 DEC 1835 , Jefferson Co., New York, Frederick Avery, b. , d. .
(8) Cyrus Steele Converse8 (Martha Burnham Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 SEP 1819 Bridgewater, Oneida Co., New York, d. 1 JUL 1900 Chili, Monroe Co., New York.
m. 16 JAN 1843 Sarah Jane Wooden, b. 5 SEP 1826 , d. 15 NOV 1868 .
(8) Cyrus Steele Converse8 (Martha Burnham Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 SEP 1819 Bridgewater, Oneida Co., New York, d. 1 JUL 1900 Chili, Monroe Co., New York.
m. Ann Norton, b. , d. .
(8) Lucy Ann Converse8 (Martha Burnham Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 APR 1821 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 24 FEB 1823 , Jefferson Co., New York.
(8) David Elliott Converse8 (Martha Burnham Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 JUN 1823 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 26 NOV 1891 .
m. 12 JUN 1850 Anne Kearney, b. , d. .
(8) Daniel Evander Converse8 (Martha Burnham Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 NOV 1826 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 31 MAY 1889 .
m. Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, Anna Walsh, b. 13 DEC 1830 Chili, Monroe Co., New York, d. 10 MAR 1894 .
(8) Lucy Jane Converse8 (Martha Burnham Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 JAN 1829 Philadelphia, Jefferson Co., New York, d. .
m. 3 JUL 1846 Chili, Monroe Co., New York, Henry Wedd, b. 15 SEP 1821 Latchingdon, Essex Co., England, d. .
Spouse NotesHENRY was a farmer. He moved his family to Kansas City, Missouri in 1858. In 1863 he bought 160 acres of land from the Indians, 16 miles from Kansas City. He later owned 660 acres.
(8) Roger Wolcott Converse8 (Martha Burnham Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 JUL 1831 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. SEP 1892 Middleville, Barry Co., Michigan.
m. NOV 1854 Maryette Heath, b. , d. .
(8) Willard Converse8 (Martha Burnham Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 MAR 1835 , Jefferson Co., New York, d. 19 SEP 1864 .
NotesWILLARD was killed in the Civil War.
m. 4 JUL 1858 Mary E. Clark, b. , d. .
(7) Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1796 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 JAN 1892 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
m. ABT 1818 William Rogers, b. 1795 , d. 24 APR 1875 Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
Spouse NotesWILLIAM and his wife, Sarah, came to Evans Mills and owned 500 acres on which they built a stone house that was still standing in 1953.
6 children: Mayette, Sally Ann, Martha, Jesse, Wolcott Alexander, Milissa.
(8) Mayette Rogers8 (Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1820 , d. 1 MAR 1901 .
m. William R. Steele, b. , d. .
(8) Sally Ann Rogers8 (Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1824 , d. 1907 .
m. George Augustus Wilkie, b. 1824 , d. 1870 .
(8) Martha Rogers8 (Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. Banjamin Carl Sawdy, b. , d. .
(8) Jesse Rogers8 (Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. Mariette Miller, b. , d. .
(8) Wolcott Alexander Rogers8 (Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1832 , d. 1905 LeRay, Jefferson Co., New York.
NotesWOLCOTT was at LeRay, New York, in 1860 with wife Laura. Later he was a dairy farmer at Evans Mills, New York.
m. Laura M. , b. 1835 , d. 1897 LeRay, Jefferson Co., New York.
(8) Milissa Rogers8 (Sarah Steele "Sally" Wolcott7, Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. William Gonan, b. , d. .
(7) Mary "Polly" Wolcott7 (Roger Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1798 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Evans Mills, Jefferson Co., New York.
NotesPOLLY and her mother came to live with her sister, Sarah Rogers, at Evans Mills, and both died there and are both buried in the Rogers plot there.
(6) Abner Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 MAR 1762 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 MAY 1762 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Jemima Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 MAY 1763 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 APR 1800 .
m. 19 NOV 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, James Steele, b. 30 AUG 1756 Of Ellington, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JAN 1819 Ellington, Tolland Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesJAMES served in the Revolutionary War and was at the siege of Boston and the Battle of Long Island. He moved from Tolland, Connecticut, to Ellington in 1776. He is said to have had 12 children.
3 children: Emily, Oliver Wolcott, Amelia.
(7) Emily Steele7 (Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. Seamans, b. , d. .
1 children: Marie.
(8) Marie Seamans8 (Emily Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. Harris Greene, b. , d. .
(7) Oliver Wolcott Steele7 (Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1784 , d. .
NotesOLIVER was a member of the Connecticut State Assembly, Town Clerk of Ellington and a Justice of the Peace. He is said to have been an antiquarian.
m. Abigail Parsons, b. , d. .
4 children: James, Mary, Martha, Jane.
(8) James Steele8 (Oliver Wolcott Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
(8) Mary Steele8 (Oliver Wolcott Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
(8) Martha Steele8 (Oliver Wolcott Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
(8) Jane Steele8 (Oliver Wolcott Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
(7) Amelia Steele7 (Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 MAR 1802 Ellington, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 19 APR 1832 Somers, Tolland Co., Connecticut, Otis Arnold Seamans, b. 28 MAR 1812 Foster, Providence Co., Rhode Island, d. 6 JUL 1862 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesOTIS served in the House of Representatives in 1853, and was a member of the Springfield Common Council in 1856 1857, and 1861.
4 children: Maria A., Amanda, Francis E. "Fanny", Sophia S..
(8) Maria A. Seamans8 (Amelia Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 JUN 1833 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. .
(8) Amanda Seamans8 (Amelia Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 APR 1836 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 AUG 1848 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
(8) Francis E. "Fanny" Seamans8 (Amelia Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 JUN 1839 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 11 NOV 1914 ,, New York.
m. 14 JUN 1863 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, John Henry Harris, b. 4 JAN 1838 Troy, Rensselaer Co., New York, d. 22 JAN 1894 .
Spouse NotesJOHN went to sea at age 18 and was shipwrecked off Nova Scotia and nearly drowned. In 1861 he enlisted in the Navy, saw considerable action, and was discharged in 1866. He studied law 1866-7, but left to be a merchant. He was in charge of the New York office of George F. Blake Manufacturing Co., and then organized the Harris Steam Pumping Company, and then was Vice-President and Manager of the Worthington Pumping Engine Co.. He was at Brooklyn, New York, in 1880.
(8) Sophia S. Seamans8 (Amelia Steele7, Jemima Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 SEP 1844 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 17 JAN 1845 Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
(6) Cornelius Wolcott6 (Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 JUL 1765 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 APR 1812 at Sea.
NotesCORNELIUS drowned in Podunk Brook, while crossing on a plank when the river was flooding. His funeral was recorded in the diary of Rev. Thomas Robbins. Podunk Brook is between Windsor and Hartford, Connecticut.
m. Margaret Williams, b. 1776 , d. 11 JAN 1819 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
7 children: William Williams, Elizabeth, Oliver, Abner, Roger, Cornelius, Martha Treat.
(7) William Williams Wolcott7 (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 6 OCT 1791 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 22 JUL 1811 .
(7) Elizabeth Wolcott7 (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 JUN 1793 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1883 Mendota, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
m. 1 JUN 1812 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Henry Gilman, b. 2 FEB 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1825 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: Charles Henry, William Wolcott, Maria, Martha.
(8) Charles Henry Gilman8 (Elizabeth Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 MAR 1817 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 15 APR 1880 Ottawa, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
NotesCHARLES was a La Salle County judge.
m. 16 NOV 1843 Roxanna Mann, b. 12 JUL 1813 Mansfield, Tioga Co., Pennsylvania, d. 19 NOV 1878 Ottawa, LaSalle Co., Illinois.
(8) William Wolcott Gilman8 (Elizabeth Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. Susan Charles, b. , d. .
(8) Maria Gilman8 (Elizabeth Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. William Valentine, b. , d. .
(8) Martha Gilman8 (Elizabeth Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
m. Andrew Lowrill, b. , d. .
(7) Oliver Wolcott7 (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 JUL 1796 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 26 NOV 1872 .
NotesOLIVER Wolcott, 50, born Connecticut, was living at Barre, New York, in 1830. He was there in 1840 with 1 male 40-50, 1 female 40-50, and 3 young females under 15. He was a farmer at Barre in 1850, with wife Mary 47, Laura Wolcott 17, Martha Wolcott 14, and William Borrows 10. In 1850 William Borrows was no longer with him. In 1860 he was at Barre with Mary and Laura S. Woolcott. In 1865 he was living with his daughter, Laura, at Barre. In 1875, part of Barre became the town of Albion.
m. 27 APR 1826 Enfield, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Mary Mumford, b. 7 SEP 1799 ,, Connecticut, d. 31 MAY 1864 .
4 children: Mary Amelia, James, Laura Sedana, Martha Elizabeth.
(8) Mary Amelia Wolcott8 (Oliver Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 FEB 1827 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. 26 JUL 1848 Barre, Orleans Co., New York.
(8) James Wolcott8 (Oliver Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1831 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. .
(8) Laura Sedana Wolcott8 (Oliver Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 MAR 1833 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. .
m. 19 NOV 1864 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, Theodore Birch, b. 1831 , Wayne Co., New York, d. .
(8) Martha Elizabeth Wolcott8 (Oliver Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 SEP 1836 Barre, Orleans Co., New York, d. 3 FEB 1911 Albion, Orleans Co., New York.
m. 26 JAN 1860 ,, New York, Carlton A. Paine, b. 2 APR 1834 ,, New York, d. 17 MAR 1901 Barre, Orleans Co., New York.
Spouse NotesCARLTON was a farmer at Barre, new York, in 1880.
(7) Abner Wolcott7 (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 AUG 1798 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 OCT 1854 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois.
NotesABNER was a millwright. He moved to Iowa in 1837. He was one of the first three County Commissionesr for Johnson County, Iowa, elected in 1838. He served on the first Grand Jury and made out the first tax list for the county. In 1841 Abner Woolcott of Johnson Co., Iowa, purchased 80 acres of government land in Iowa. He left Iowa in 1843 for Rock Island, Illinois. He purchased a farm on Lowell Island near Milan, Illinois. In 1850 he was a millwright at Rock Island Co., Illinois, with wife Elizabeth, 25 or 29 born Ohio, and Cornelius 4, and John 5 mo. both born Illinois.
m. 8 APR 1844 , Rock Island Co., Illinois, Elizabeth Ann Wisecarver, b. 1825 ,, Ohio, d. .
4 children: Cornelius Roger, John Abner, Katheryn, William Henry.
(8) Cornelius Roger Wolcott8 (Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 OCT 1845 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. 24 OCT 1921 .
NotesCORNELIUS R. Wolcott of Black Hawk, Illinios, enlisted 4 Oct. 1864 as a Pvt. in Co. I, 126th Illinois Inf. Regt., and was mustered out when the unit was disbanded on 12 July 1865.

Nora Wolcott, dates and relationship unknown, is buried in the same cemetery.
m. 23 OCT 1867 , Rock Island Co., Illinois, Sarah Zeonora Zabrisky, b. 13 JUN 1850 , d. 30 JAN 1926 .
(8) John Abner Wolcott8 (Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1850 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. .
(8) Katheryn Wolcott8 (Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. .
(8) William Henry Wolcott8 (Abner Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 MAY 1852 Rock Island, Rock Island Co., Illinois, d. 14 AUG 1935 .
NotesWILLIAM was a railroad brakeman at Muscatine, Iowa, in 1880. He was a minister at Allison, Iowa, 1906-8. His gravestone reads "Engineer Clergyman".
m. 4 NOV 1874 Alice Lucinda Wilson, b. 1857 Pen Hook,, Indiana, d. 17 JAN 1932 Sergent Bluff, Woodbury Co., Iowa.
Spouse NotesALICE's gravestone reads "Pastors wife Teacher".
(7) Roger Wolcott7 (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 MAY 1800 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
NotesROGER is said to have "Gone South".
(7) Cornelius Wolcott7 (Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 SEP 1807 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 23 JAN 1848 Springfield, Hampshire, after 1812 Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesCORNELIUS Woolcott of Enfield married Sophia Hall of Longmeadow at Longmeadow. His gravestone reads: Cornelius Wolcott died Jan. 13 1848 ae. 41.
m. 25 JAN 1827 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Sophia Sweatland Hall, b. 13 JAN 1813 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 18 NOV 1858 Springfield, Hampshire, after 1812 Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesSOPHIA's last name is sometimes given as Hale, but her great-granddaughter, Lois Wolcott said it was Sophia Sweatland Hall. In 1880, Minerva Swetland, widow, born 1802 Connecticut, was living with Oliver Wolcott and listed as his aunt. Her gravestone reads: Sophia wife of Cornelius Wolcott died Nov. 18 1858 aged 71 yrs.
2 children: Oliver, Gordon Hall.
(8) Oliver Wolcott8 (Cornelius Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 MAY 1827 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 NOV 1888 Palmer, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesOLIVER was orphaned at a young age and was raised by Quakers at Enfield, Connecticut. He came to East Longmeadow, Massachusetts, in 1852, where he was a stone mason. He became foreman of a sandstone quarry at East Long Meadow. He and wife, Amelia, were at Longmeadow in 1860, with Amelia's daughter Rosa C. Wolcott. He was one of the founders of the Methodist Church there, and a trustee until his death. He was a farmer at Longmeadow in 1880. He did not have a middle name, according to his great-grandson, John Martin. It was previously thought to be Louis.
m. 18 JAN 1854 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Emily Jane "Emma" Salisbury, b. 1 JUN 1834 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 AUG 1858 East Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
(8) Oliver Wolcott8 (Cornelius Wolcott7, Cornelius Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 MAY 1827 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 NOV 1888 Palmer, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesOLIVER was orphaned at a young age and was raised by Quakers at Enfield, Connecticut. He came to East Longmeadow, Massachusetts, in 1852, where he was a stone mason. He became foreman of a sandstone quarry at East Long Meadow. He and wife, Amelia, were at Longmeadow in 1860, with Amelia's daughter Rosa C. Wolcott. He was one of the founders of the Methodist Church there, and a trustee until his death. He was a farmer at Longmeadow in 1880. He did not have a middle name, according to his great-grandson, John Martin. It was previously thought to be Louis.
m. 11 MAY 1860 Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Lydia Amelia Crocker, b. 22 JUN 1829 South Wilbraham, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. 2 APR 1895 East Longmeadow, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.

m. 7 MAY 1870 Green Tew Kenyon, b. 21 AUG 1842 Richmond,, Rhode Island, d. 15 JUL 1888 Branford, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesGREEN was a stove dealer at Hartford, Connecticut, until 1875 when he moved to Brandon.

NotesWILLIAM "Henry" Wolcott was a machinist at Hartford, Connecticut, in 1850 with Almyra, Ella, and Frances Wolcott. William was at East Hartford, Connecticut, in 1860, with Almira, Ella J., and Frances Wolcott.

1870 East Hartford CT:
Wm H Wolcott M 60y, blacksmith
Almira Wolcott 44y
Ella Wolcott 23y, book binder
Fanny Wolcott 20y, book binder

He was a farmer at East Hartford in 1880.
Wm. H. Wolcott M 70
Spouse Almira Wolcott 54
Child Ella Wolcott 34

(7) Mary Cornelia Burbridge7 (Rhoda Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 APR 1816 ,, Connecticut, d. 4 OCT 1903 .
NotesMARY Tillotson was with son Frances Tillotson, farmer, at Osawkie, Kansas, in 1881. Mrs. Marion L. Aten, joined the Wolcott Society as member 14 in 1914, residing at Chicago, Illinois.Possibly two different people.
m. Marion L. Aten, b. , d. .
1 children: Marion Burbridge.
(8) Marion Burbridge Aten8 (Mary Cornelia Burbridge7, Rhoda Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1840 , d. .
NotesMrs. Maria Burbridge Aten of Chicago was said to be the granddaughter of Rhoda Wolcott, born in Windsor, Connecticut, who came west when a young girl. She and Miss Stella Wolcott Aten attended the reunion of the Wolcott Society in 1914. Mrs. Marion L. Aten and Miss Stella Aten were members of the Wolcott Society in 1914. Mrs. Maria L. Aten and Stella were members in 1915. The 1918 Wolcott Society annual report gave Asa Burbridge and Elmer McLaughlin as grandsons of William and Caroline Burbridge, and cousins of Stella Wolcott Aten.
m. Maria L. , b. ABT 1850 , d. SEP 1916 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesMARIA L. Aten of Chicago was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914, and a member of the executive committee in 1915. She was referred to as Mrs. Marion L. Aten, Mrs. Maria L. Aten, Mrs. Maria B. Aten, Maria Burbridge Aten. She is said to be a granddaughter of Rhoda Wolcott who married Charles Burbridge. We are assuming that she was married to Marion Aten. She and Miss Stella Aten, possibly her daughter, attended the 1914 Society reunion.
(7) William H. Burbridge7 (Rhoda Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1818 ,, Massachusetts, d. Quincy, Adams Co., Illinois.
m. Caroline M. , b. 1819 ,, Canada, d. .
2 children: Charles S., .
