(8) Burbridge8 (William H. Burbridge7, Rhoda Wolcott6, Roger Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1875 , d. .
m. McLaughlin , b. ABT 1875 , d. .
(5) Epaphras Wolcott5 (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 MAY 1740 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 JAN 1825 .
NotesEPAPHRAS was at East Windsor, Connecticut, in 1790, with family of 1 male over 16 and 5 females. He is said to have enlisted in Capt. Giles Wolcott's Company and died while on that unit's expedition to Canada. If, so, the death date we have for him must be wrong. He is also said to have married at Rochester NY, which also seems to be in error.
m. JUN 1762 Mabel Burnham, b. 1735 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 27 MAR 1814 .
4 children: Sarah, James, Mabel, Mary.
(6) Sarah Wolcott6 (Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 JAN 1764 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 NOV 1853 Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts.
m. 5 FEB 1795 Wilbraham, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Ebenezer Pomeroy, b. 1759 Of Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 26 OCT 1840 .
Spouse NotesEBENEZER served in the Revolutionary War.
1 children: Infant.
(7) Infant Pomeroy7 (Sarah Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 MAR 1796 Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 11 MAR 1796 Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts.
(6) James Wolcott6 (Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 APR 1766 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 29 APR 1849 Wheatland, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesJAMES lived at East Windsor, Connecticut, where the birth of his sons, Anson, James, and Epaphras was recorded. He was there in 1790 with a family of 1 male over 16, 2 males under 16, and 1 female. He was an officer in the militia during in the War of 1812. His sword was given to his grandson, James MacGregor Wolcott, and was passed on to James' grandaughter, Jessie Humphrey Hunt. He settled at East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, where he lived for many years. He was living at Bloomfield in 1830. He and his wife later moved to Wheatland, New York, to live with their daughter, Miriam. A monument in the Wheatland Baptist Cemetery lists his children, Anson, Epaphras, James, Norman, and Miriam, and says: Anson married Lurinda Hawley Gillett at Mendon, NY. A successful and beloved teacher of Indians, English and deaf and dumb children. They settled in East Bloomfield NY. Prospered, were honored members of Bristol Baptist Church and large contributors. They had eight children." A small book about his descendants was printed by Chandler Wolcott in 1907.
m. JAN 1786 Wheatland, Monroe Co., New York, Miriam Munsell, b. 15 JAN 1767 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 JAN 1850 Wheatland, Monroe Co., New York.
7 children: Anson, Epaphras, James, Norman, Miriam, Sarah, Sarah.
(7) Anson Wolcott7 (James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 APR 1787 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 OCT 1864 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York.
NotesANSON came from the Springfield Armory, where he was employed, to Bloomfield, New York, to join his brother, Epaphras, in operating a distillery. Epaphras moved to Rochester, and Anson was joined by his brother, Norman. In 1826, Anson and Norman of Bloomfield registered a patent for "distilling all kinds of liquor". In 1827 they registered another patent for "extracting alcohol from common spirits by steam. Anson also patented an improved still for making alcohol from apples in 1836. In 1837 he deeded land at Ontario County, New York, to his brother, James Wolcott, Jr. He and his brother, Epaphras, also started a silk business, raising their own silkworms. He was at East Bloomfield in 1860 with Lurinda, Lurinda, Esther, and Emily Wolcott. In 1860 Anson Wolcott of East Bloomfield had a storekeeper's license. A monument to the children of James and Miriam Wolcott at Wheatland Baptiat Cemetery reads: "Anson married Lurinda Hawley Gilette at Mendon, NY. A successful and beloved teacher of Indians, English and deaf and dumb children. They settled in East Bloomfield NY. Prospered, were honored members of Bristol Baptist Church and large contributors. They had eight children."
m. 29 MAR 1821 Mendon, Monroe Co., New York, Lurinda Hawley Gillett, b. 1802 , d. 17 AUG 1869 Canandaigua, Ontario Co., New York.
7 children: Mary Ann, Susan Melissa, Anson Spencer "Spencer", Lurinda Gillette, Sarah Pomeroy, Asineath Esther "Esther", Frances Emily "Emily".
(8) Mary Ann Wolcott8 (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 APR 1823 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 2 FEB 1914 Walker, Kent Co., Michigan.
NotesMARY Ann's death certificate says she was to be buried at Canadaugua, New York.
m. 18 SEP 1849 David K. Kendall, b. 24 JAN 1816 Millbury, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 6 JUL 1862 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York.
Spouse NotesDAVID was a member of the Presbyterian Church at New Lebanon, and a member of the Masons.
(8) Susan Melissa Wolcott8 (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 JAN 1825 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 27 DEC 1855 .
m. 17 OCT 1858 , Ontario Co., New York, Ezekiel J. Scudder, b. 17 FEB 1819 , d. 25 FEB 1878 .
(8) Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott8 (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 MAR 1827 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 23 AUG 1911 Fayette, Howard Co., Missouri.
NotesANSON is also said to have been born in 1821. He was at East Bloomfield, New York, in 1860, with Sarah, Charles, and Eliza Wolcott. He was a fruit grower at Prairie, Missouri, in 1880.
m. 2 AUG 1855 Sarah P. Walker, b. 13 JUN 1829 Canandaigua, Ontario Co., New York, d. 9 MAY 1882 Prairie, Howard Co., Missouri.
(8) Anson Spencer "Spencer" Wolcott8 (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 MAR 1827 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 23 AUG 1911 Fayette, Howard Co., Missouri.
NotesANSON is also said to have been born in 1821. He was at East Bloomfield, New York, in 1860, with Sarah, Charles, and Eliza Wolcott. He was a fruit grower at Prairie, Missouri, in 1880.
m. 6 AUG 1884 Kahoka.Clark Co., Missouri, Phebe A. Church, b. , d. .
(8) Lurinda Gillette Wolcott8 (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 FEB 1829 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 24 AUG 1896 Bristol, Ontario Co., New York.
NotesLURENDA is also said to be buried at Fayette, Missouri.
m. ABT 1850 Simon P. Hall, b. 1826 , d. 1903 Bristol, Ontario Co., New York.
Spouse NotesSIMON served in the Civil War.
(8) Sarah Pomeroy Wolcott8 (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 SEP 1832 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 3 JUN 1850 .
(8) Asineath Esther "Esther" Wolcott8 (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1840 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. .
m. 15 AUG 1864 Delinar W. Scudder, b. 1840 ,, New York, d. .
Spouse NotesDELIVAN Scudder 40, farmer, was a Randolph, New York, in 1880 with wife Ella 40 and daughter Grace 12, all born in New York.
(8) Frances Emily "Emily" Wolcott8 (Anson Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 AUG 1842 East Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. .
m. 27 MAY 1866 Theodore Parker Whiting, b. , d. 20 APR 1878 Harrison Valley, Potter Co., Pennsylvania.
(7) Epaphras Wolcott7 (James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 APR 1789 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 25 AUG 1852 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesEPAPHRAS was employed at the Springfield Armory. He left there and walked to New York state about 1808, and in 1811 purchased land in Wayne County, in what is now the town of Wolcott. He moved to Bloomfield, Ontario County, where he deeded land to Thomas and Benjamin Wheeler in 1814, Nathaniel, Lyman, and William Keyes in 1821, Richard Paul in 1821, nson Wolcott in 1821, Timothy Wilder in 1825, and Norman Wolcott in 1826. He appears on the Bloomfield 1820 census. His brother, Anson, joined him there in the operation of a distillery. In 1827 he moved to Rochester, where in 1830 he built the Wolcott Distillery and the Wolcott Tavern which he managed. His large frame house is still standing on the southwest corner of Mt. Hope Avenue and Clarissa St., looking much as it did in 1830 when the forest came to the very door of the house.

He is on the 1830 census at Brighton, Monroe Co., New York, which is near Rochester. Epaphras was a member of the First Baptist Church and was often called upon to speak at public meetings.
m. 25 MAY 1811 Naomi Paul, b. 19 AUG 1791 , d. 11 NOV 1853 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
7 children: Sarah Munsell, Anson Franklin, George Paul, Elvira Antoinette, Oliver Epaphras, Georgianna Melvina, Julia M..
(8) Sarah Munsell Wolcott8 (Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 OCT 1812 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 11 AUG 1903 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesSARAH was a charter member of the Second Baptist Church at Rochester, New York, in 1834.
m. 13 FEB 1834 David R. Barton, b. 4 JUL 1805 , d. 25 APR 1875 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
Spouse NotesDAVID learned the nail making trade at Rochester, and then moved to Ramapo, New York, and then returned to Rochester and set up a tool making business in 1832. He was a pioneer in the manufacture of edge tools, and built a large business, the D. R. Barton Company, employing 193 people in 1870. He was a deacon in the Baptist Church at Rochester, New York, and one of the founders of the city hospital.
(8) Anson Franklin Wolcott8 (Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 JUN 1814 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 6 APR 1892 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesANSON lived most of his life at Rochester, New York.

1850 Rochester NY:
Anson F Wolcott M 36y
Elisa Ann Wolcott F 27y

In 1873 Anson and his brother, George, continued the distillery and tavern built by their father, as A. F & G. P. Wolcott, Distillers. In 1880 he was retired, living at Rochester, New York.
m. 13 OCT 1846 Ann Eliza Combs, b. 2 MAR 1822 ,, New York, d. 19 APR 1904 .
(8) George Paul Wolcott8 (Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 NOV 1816 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 10 AUG 1880 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesGEORGE was a partner with his brother, Anson, in the distillery business at Rochester, New York. He served in the Civil War.

1850 Rochester NY:
George P Wolcott M 33y
Caroline E Wolcott F 28y
Henry E Wolcott M 2y
James E Wolcott M 1m
Maria Dutcher F 26y

He was at Rochester in 1879 with James E., Frank A,

1880 Rochester NY
James E. Wolcott M 30
Ida J. Wolcott F 27
Caroline R. Wolcott F 3
George P. Wolcott M 63
Maggie Gutberlet F 24
m. 26 MAY 1846 Caroline Elizabeth Moore, b. 15 APR 1822 , d. 7 OCT 1871 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
(8) Elvira Antoinette Wolcott8 (Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 SEP 1820 Bloomfield, Ontario Co., New York, d. 24 SEP 1865 .
m. 26 JUN 1860 Edward Jackson Jenks, b. 3 MAR 1817 ,, Massachusetts, d. .
Spouse NotesEDWARD worked at Rochester, New York for 5 years and then worked 5 years as book keeper of the Bank of Brighton. He became cashier of the Woburn bank in 1853 and remained there 18 years. In 1875 he became cashier of the Hopkinton National Bank and treasurer of the Hopkinton Savings Bank.
(8) Oliver Epaphras Wolcott8 (Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 MAR 1827 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 21 OCT 1829 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
(8) Georgianna Melvina Wolcott8 (Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 JUN 1834 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 15 SEP 1835 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
(8) Julia M. Wolcott8 (Epaphras Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1838 , d. 11 MAY 1865 .
NotesJulia is placed here because she was buried in the pot owned by Epaphras' sons. She may be an in-law.

The funeral of the late Mrs. P.B. VIELE took place yesterday afternoon from the family residence, No. 139 North Union street. The services were conducted by Rev. Dr. RIGGS, assisted by Rev. Mr. BARSTOW. The deceased
was the daughter of the late Carlos and Billings DUTTON and is survived by
her husband, P.B. VIELE, secretary and treasurer of the East Side Savings
Bank, two sons, George B. CHASE of Cleveland and Benjamin B. CHASE, secretary
of the Title and Guarantee Company of this city, also two sisters, Mrs.
Abby G. HOWLAND of Perry, N.Y., and Mrs. Churchill H. CUTTING of Brooklyn.
m. Platt B. Viele, b. 1829 ,, New York, d. .
Spouse NotesHe was a banker and apparently a widower in 1870 living with his parents Platt C. and Phoebe Viele. A widowed banker at Rochester with his parents in 1880.
(7) James Wolcott7 (James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 MAY 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 4 APR 1866 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
NotesJAMES settled at Rome, Oneida Co., New York, where all his children were born. He had a sawmill at Rome. He was at Chicago, Illinois, in 1860, and died there in the home of his son, Ebenezer. James was a Presbyterian.
m. 13 NOV 1814 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, Lovisa Emily Gould, b. 15 JUL 1792 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. ABT 1854 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York.
9 children: Ebenezer Gould, Norman, William, Anson Gould, Chauncey Smith, Francis Story, Charles Darwin, Beulah Ann, James Henry.
(8) Ebenezer Gould Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 SEP 1815 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 30 DEC 1885 Wolcottville, LaGrange Co., Indiana.
NotesEBENEZER was at Belvedere, Illinois, in 1850, with wife Maria L. 29, and daughter, Ella, 2. He was a produce dealer at Oswego, New York, in 1859. He was at Chicago, Illinois, in 1860, recorded as Edgar G. Woolcott, with Maria L., Charles, Ellen M., and his father, James Wolcott. He was also at Chicago in 1870, recorded as Edward G., with wife Mary L., and daughter Ella. He and 5 other men together purchased 400 acres of land in Michigan in 1870. In 1880, E. G. Wolcott was a produce merchant at Chicago, Illinois.
m. 17 AUG 1843 Maria Louise Brown, b. MAY 1820 Caledonia, Monroe Co., New York, d. 29 NOV 1905 Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesMARIA joined the Belcoda Baptist Church at Wheatland, New York, in 1845.
(8) Norman Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 SEP 1817 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. .
(8) William Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 SEP 1817 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 30 SEP 1817 Rome, Oneida Co., New York.
(8) Anson Gould Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 OCT 1819 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 10 JAN 1907 Wolcott, White Co., Indiana.
NotesANSON began teaching school in Ontario County, New York, at the age of 15. When he was 21 he went to Claibourne Parish, Louisiana, and studied law with Judge Peets. He was admitted to the New York bar at Buffalo, New York, in 1842, and to the Supreme Court in 1852. He was a lawyer, farmer, and grain merchant. He purchased 2,000 acres of land from the Holland Land Co. in Royalton Township, Niagra Co., New York, and settled on it in 1847. He dug a well and built a steam sawmil, He employed a large number of men in cutting and processing lumber, and built a boarding house for them to live in. He was living at Lockport, New York, in 1850. Lockport is adjascent to Royalton. In 1851 he deeded his land to four trustees who divided the land into small plots. He came to Indiana as an attorney for a railroad company, and purchased several square miles of land where the railroad would be located. The town of Wolcottsville was laid out in 1861, next to the Toledo, Logansport, and Burlington Railroad, later part of the Pennsylvania Railroad. It was named in his honor. On an errand to Washington, D.C. in 1861, he heard of the Confederate attack on the Union Army at Bull Run and hastened to the battle area to assist in the fight, receiving a minor wound. He and his brother, Ebenezer, settled in Princeton Township, White Co., Indiana, in 1858, and laid out a town that became Wolcott, Indiana, in 1861. Here Anson built a large 14 room home in 1864, later occupied by his son, Eben. The home is still standing at 500 N. Range St., and is listed on the National Registry of Historical Places. He had a large farm called Wolcott Farm. In 1956 it was given by his grandson, Roger Wolcot, to Princeton Township. It is now the home of the Anson Wolcott Historical Society, who began restoring it in 1974. In 1868 Anson was elected as a Republican to the Indiana State Senate, where he was Chairman of the Finance Committee. He was reelected in 1871, and was Chairman of the Finance Committee . In 1872, his trustees in New York sold lots to seventy five families from Prussia, who drew lots for the land. Anson moved his sawmill from Wolcottsville, New York, to Erie Co., New York, at that time. In 1876 he was nominated for Governor on the Greenback Party ticket., but in later years returned to the Republican party. In 1880 he was an attorney, living in a boarding house at Logansport, Indiana. He later resided in Denver, Colorado, where he owned considerable mining property.
m. 12 JUL 1848 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, Elizabeth Walbridge, b. 2 APR 1823 Geneva, Ontario Co., New York, d. 26 APR 1909 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York.
(8) Anson Gould Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 OCT 1819 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 10 JAN 1907 Wolcott, White Co., Indiana.
NotesANSON began teaching school in Ontario County, New York, at the age of 15. When he was 21 he went to Claibourne Parish, Louisiana, and studied law with Judge Peets. He was admitted to the New York bar at Buffalo, New York, in 1842, and to the Supreme Court in 1852. He was a lawyer, farmer, and grain merchant. He purchased 2,000 acres of land from the Holland Land Co. in Royalton Township, Niagra Co., New York, and settled on it in 1847. He dug a well and built a steam sawmil, He employed a large number of men in cutting and processing lumber, and built a boarding house for them to live in. He was living at Lockport, New York, in 1850. Lockport is adjascent to Royalton. In 1851 he deeded his land to four trustees who divided the land into small plots. He came to Indiana as an attorney for a railroad company, and purchased several square miles of land where the railroad would be located. The town of Wolcottsville was laid out in 1861, next to the Toledo, Logansport, and Burlington Railroad, later part of the Pennsylvania Railroad. It was named in his honor. On an errand to Washington, D.C. in 1861, he heard of the Confederate attack on the Union Army at Bull Run and hastened to the battle area to assist in the fight, receiving a minor wound. He and his brother, Ebenezer, settled in Princeton Township, White Co., Indiana, in 1858, and laid out a town that became Wolcott, Indiana, in 1861. Here Anson built a large 14 room home in 1864, later occupied by his son, Eben. The home is still standing at 500 N. Range St., and is listed on the National Registry of Historical Places. He had a large farm called Wolcott Farm. In 1956 it was given by his grandson, Roger Wolcot, to Princeton Township. It is now the home of the Anson Wolcott Historical Society, who began restoring it in 1974. In 1868 Anson was elected as a Republican to the Indiana State Senate, where he was Chairman of the Finance Committee. He was reelected in 1871, and was Chairman of the Finance Committee . In 1872, his trustees in New York sold lots to seventy five families from Prussia, who drew lots for the land. Anson moved his sawmill from Wolcottsville, New York, to Erie Co., New York, at that time. In 1876 he was nominated for Governor on the Greenback Party ticket., but in later years returned to the Republican party. In 1880 he was an attorney, living in a boarding house at Logansport, Indiana. He later resided in Denver, Colorado, where he owned considerable mining property.
m. 11 FEB 1863 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, Georgiana De Ismisquero Sayne, b. Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. 4 AUG 1877 Wolcott, White Co., Indiana.
(8) Chauncey Smith Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 NOV 1821 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 28 DEC 1890 Portland, Ionia Co., Michigan.
NotesCHAUNCEY was a farmer at Lockport, New York, in 1850 with wife Sarah M. and daughter Sarah M. Wolcott. He later worked in sales and manufacturing. For the last 22 years of his life he was in the shoe business and the grocery business at Portland, Michigan.
m. 24 SEP 1849 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, Sarah M. Wakeman, b. 3 JUL 1828 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, d. 16 JUL 1850 .
(8) Chauncey Smith Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 NOV 1821 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 28 DEC 1890 Portland, Ionia Co., Michigan.
NotesCHAUNCEY was a farmer at Lockport, New York, in 1850 with wife Sarah M. and daughter Sarah M. Wolcott. He later worked in sales and manufacturing. For the last 22 years of his life he was in the shoe business and the grocery business at Portland, Michigan.
m. 1850 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, Adaline Brockway, b. 20 JUN 1830 ,, New York, d. 20 AUG 1898 Portland, Ionia Co., Michigan.
(8) Francis Story Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 NOV 1821 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 4 JAN 1822 .
(8) Charles Darwin Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 JUN 1825 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 16 JUN 1844 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York.
NotesCHARLES drowned.
(8) Beulah Ann Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 AUG 1827 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 17 NOV 1891 Erie, Erie Co., Pennsylvania.
m. 21 AUG 1845 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York, Benjamin Hawley Fletcher, b. 13 NOV 1913 Bridport, Addison Co., Vermont, d. 1 MAR 1991 Lockport, Niagara Co., New York.
(8) James Henry Wolcott8 (James Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 MAR 1831 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 24 NOV 1895 La Grange, Cook Co., Illinois.
NotesJAMES was a broker. He helped his father run a sawmill in Rome, New York, and then moved to New York City where he had a wholesale dry goods business. He then moved to Galena, Illinois and operated a meat packing business. In 1858 he moved to Chicago and had a meat packing business at the Chicago Stock Yard. He lived at Pepin, Wisconsin, where he was in 1860, with wife Kate and daughter, Beulah L. Wolcott. He was at Chicago in 1870 with Kate R., Beulah L., James G., Katie W. and Ebenezer G. He helped organize the Chicago Board of Trade. He moved from Galena, Illinois, to LaGrange, Illinois, about 1880, where he built a home at Maple and Madison Aves.
m. 27 OCT 1857 Galena, Jo Daviess Co., Illinois, Kathryn "Kate" Reinwald, b. 19 OCT 1834 Baltimore, Baltimore Co., Maryland, d. 15 OCT 1926 LaGrange, DuPage Co., Illinois.
Spouse NotesKATHRYN came by covered wagon to Chicago with her family in 1836, and travelled up the Mississippi River to Galena, where they built a log cabin. Her name is spelled Catherine Reinwalt on her marriage record.
(7) Norman Wolcott7 (James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 APR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 OCT 1852 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky.
NotesNORMAN came to Bloomfield, New York, to help his brother, Anson, operate a silkworm business. He moved to Warren County, Ohio, about 1819. Norman, his wife and infant son, and the Henry family, left there on a flatboat, en route to New Orleans. Coming down the Ohio River they encountered a lot of ice, so they spent the winter of 1820 camped at the mouth of the Green River. The Henry family continued down the river, but left their son, James, with the Wolcotts. James later married Norman's daughter. In the spring, Norman, continued up the Green River and settled at a place on the Green River, 6 miles north of South Carrollton, Kentucky. This became known as Wolcott's Landing. There he built a grist mill. He operated the mill until he got his arm crushed in the mill machinery. He later died of the injury.

1850 Ohio, Ohio Co. KY:Norman Walcott 56 Massachusetts, miller
Mary A Walcott F 54 North Carolina
Oliver H Walcott M 22 New York, Distiller
Nancy J Walcott F 19 New York
Isabella Cole F 65 North Carolina
next to James Walcott,29, b. OH, distiller
Louisa Walcott, 15
m. 1 FEB 1820 , Warren Co., Ohio, Mary Ann Mac Gregor, b. 1797 Aberdeen,, Scotland, d. 24 OCT 1862 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky.
5 children: James MacGregor, Christina, Anson, Oliver Hector, Nancy Jane,
(8) James MacGregor Wolcott8 (Norman Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 NOV 1820 , Warren Co., Ohio, d. 24 AUG 1896 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
NotesJAMES operated his father's mill at Wolcott's Landing. Later he was Captain of a Green River steamer, called "The Enterprise", on which he built a saw mill. He traveled the Green River sawing lumber for landowners who lived along the river. During the Civil War, he organized and was Capt. of the home militia. He built a grist mill at South Carrolton, Kentucky. In 1880 he was a Miller and Engineer at South Carrollton.
m. 10 JAN 1850 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky, Louisa Jane "Jennie" Bullock, b. 25 AUG 1832 ,, Kentucky, d. 22 APR 1875 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
(8) Christina Wolcott8 (Norman Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 NOV 1822 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 27 NOV 1886 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
m. 2 APR 1846 James Henry, b. 1822 ,, Ohio, d. 2 MAR 1867 South Carrollton, Muhlenberg Co., Kentucky.
Spouse NotesJAMES came to Kentucky as a young man, settling at South Carrolton. He was a shoemaker and farmer.
(8) Anson Wolcott8 (Norman Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 FEB 1825 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 8 JUL 1826 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky.
(8) Oliver Hector Wolcott8 (Norman Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 JAN 1828 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. APR 1863 .
Notes1850 Ohio KY:


Oliver Walcot was a farmer, age 33, born New Jersey, at Point Pleasant, Ohio Co., Kentucky, in 1860, with Sarah 30, Christina 7, Augustus 6, Alva 5, Millard F. 3, and Marinda 1, all born in Kentucky. Oliver served in the Union Army during the Civil War. He was severely wounded at the Battle of Shilow. A crucial part of this battle took place in a peach orchard where the trees were in bloom. As the battle raged, petals fell like snow. It was here that Oliver was wounded. He received a disability discharge at Pittsburg Landing 7 April 1862, and never fully recovered from his wounds. The gun carried in the war by Oliver, and a bowie knife belonging to him, were owned by his niece, Rena Wolcott Crabtree.
m. 1851 Sarah Ellen "Sally" Dexter, b. 1830 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. 1862 , Ohio Co., Kentucky.
(8) Nancy Jane Wolcott8 (Norman Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 FEB 1831 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. .
m. 19 AUG 1857 , Ohio Co., Kentucky, Reason H. Everly, b. , d. .
(8) Nancy Jane Wolcott8 (Norman Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 FEB 1831 Wolcott's Landing, Ohio Co., Kentucky, d. .
m. 2 JUL 1865 John A. Townes, b. , d. .
(7) Miriam Wolcott7 (James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 NOV 1795 ,, Connecticut, d. 28 JUL 1878 .
m. 22 MAR 1820 Rawson Harmon, b. 3 SEP 1794 Mumford, Monroe Co., New York, d. 24 JUN 1873 Mumford, Monroe Co., New York.
Spouse NotesRAWSON's was a noted wheat farmer and his farm was called Wheatland Farm. He was awarded a gold meadal at the first World Fair held in the Crystal Palace near London, England for his display of 35 varieties of wheat all grown on his Wheatland Farm. He served in the War 1812. In 1846 he opened an agricultural school on his farm, of which he was principal.
3 children: Hortense, Antoinette Louise, Norman.
(8) Hortense Harmon8 (Miriam Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1822 , d. 1897 .
m. 16 SEP 1845 John Murdock, b. , d. .
(8) Hortense Harmon8 (Miriam Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1822 , d. 1897 .
m. 2 FEB 1881 Nicholas Keeney, b. , d. .
(8) Antoinette Louise Harmon8 (Miriam Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 AUG 1839 Mumford, Monroe Co., New York, d. 7 FEB 1921 .
m. 26 SEP 1860 Theodore S. Goddard, b. 1 SEP 1831 , d. 12 SEP 1885 Los Angeles, Los Angeles Co., California.
Spouse NotesTHEODORE moved to Sioux Falls, South Dakota, in the 1860s.
(8) Norman Harmon8 (Miriam Wolcott7, James Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. 7 FEB 1921 .

(8) Martha Jane Richardson8 (William Richardson7, Mabel Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 JAN 1833 Hadley, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 26 SEP 1835 .
(7) Mabel Richardson7 (Mabel Wolcott6, Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 MAY 1809 Springfield, Hampshire, after 1812 Hampden Co., Massachusetts, d. .

(6) Mary Wolcott6 (Epaphras Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 JUL 1773 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 26 NOV 1795 Wilbraham, Hampden Co., Massachusetts, Aaron Davis, b. , d. .
(5) Mary Wolcott5 (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 APR 1742 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 22 APR 1764 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, Jesse Goodell, b. 8 DEC 1738 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 14 JUN 1776 .
Spouse NotesJESSE studied divinity at Yale University and was licensed to preach in 1763. He organized at church at Westminister, Vermont, and was installed as pastor in 1767. "His carer at Westminister was cut short by the discovery of some immoralities in which he had been concerned, and he left town secretly, without a dismission from his office about the first of December, 1769. Mrs. Goodell's brothers are said to have taken her back to their home in Connecticut with her two children. ("Biographical Sketches of the Graduates of Yale College"). He was a chaplain in the Revolutionary Army, and may have died during the War.
3 children: Martha, Thomas, Sarah.
(6) Martha Goodell6 (Mary Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 AUG 1762 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. .
(6) Thomas Goodell6 (Mary Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 AUG 1764 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. .
(6) Sarah Goodell6 (Mary Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 MAY 1767 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. .
(5) Emeline Wolcott5 (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 OCT 1744 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 25 FEB 1745 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(5) Parmenio Wolcott5 (Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1746 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 9 JAN 1812 Rome, Oneida Co., New York.
NotesPARMENIO moved to Rome, New York, shortly after his marriage. He had a farm there. However, he appears on the 1790 census at East Windsor, with a family of 2 males over 16, 1 male under 16, and 3 females. Information about his family is found in an 1825 Bible, apparently recorded by his daughter, Mary Wolcott Stone.
m. 1767 Wallingford, New Haven Co., Connecticut, Mary Ballard, b. 11 OCT 1750 Lancaster, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. 2 MAR 1833 Rome, Oneida Co., New York.
8 children: Alfred, Parmenio, Prudence, , Josiah, Mary "Polly", Prudence, Lydia.
(6) Alfred Wolcott6 (Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 APR 1769 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 20 NOV 1835 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesALFRED came to the Western Reserve, which later became Ohio, in 1796. He had been hired as a surveyor by John Young, the founder of Youngstown. He also surveyed the towns of Canfield and Bristol, for which the Connecticut Land Co. gave him 350 acres of land as payment. He erected the first building in Bristol Township. His marriage to Mary Gilson in 1800 was the first marriage in the county, but the ceremony was actually performed in Pennsylvania as there was no minister in Mahoning County. Mary must have died soon after their marriage, for by 1806 he had bought half of Boston Township in Portage County, and had gone there to clear the ground for his farm, and to build a log house for his new bride, Margaret Craig Wolcott. Alfred was a taxpayer in Portage Co. in 1808. This part of Portage County later became Summit County. Alfred was elected Justice of the Peace in the first election, and also serving as a fence-viewer. His old record book containing all cases that came to him as Justice was in the possession of his great-grandson, Oliver Wolcott, of Copley, Ohio. The Wolcott's daughter Malinda was the first white child born in Boston Township. In 1816 a log schoolhouse was built in the Wolcott neighborhood, and Alfred Wolcott was the first schoolmaster. It is said that there was a tiny school near his home in which he taught as early as 1812. Alfred served in Capt. Rial McArthur's Co. from August to October 1812, during the War of 1812. His will left his land, about 119 acres, to his wife, Margaret, with the exception of a half acre left as a burial ground for the township of Boston, now called the Fairview Cemetery, established in 1890.
m. 1800 Mary Gilson, b. , d. .
1 children: Lydia.
(7) Lydia Wolcott7 (Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1804 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1 JUN 1834 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesLYDIA died of Tuberculosis, age 32.
m. 23 FEB 1823 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio, George Leach, b. 1798 Goshen, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 31 JUL 1853 .
5 children: Clarissa, Eliza, Lydia, Luman George, George.
(8) Clarissa Leach8 (Lydia Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. Allen Ingersoll, b. , d. .
(8) Clarissa Leach8 (Lydia Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. S. Gaylord, b. , d. .
(8) Eliza Leach8 (Lydia Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
(8) Lydia Leach8 (Lydia Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. Conrad Schoch, b. , d. .
(8) Luman George Leach8 (Lydia Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1829 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 31 JAN 1832 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(8) George Leach8 (Lydia Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. JUN 1833 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 31 JUL 1833 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(6) Alfred Wolcott6 (Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 APR 1769 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. 20 NOV 1835 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesALFRED came to the Western Reserve, which later became Ohio, in 1796. He had been hired as a surveyor by John Young, the founder of Youngstown. He also surveyed the towns of Canfield and Bristol, for which the Connecticut Land Co. gave him 350 acres of land as payment. He erected the first building in Bristol Township. His marriage to Mary Gilson in 1800 was the first marriage in the county, but the ceremony was actually performed in Pennsylvania as there was no minister in Mahoning County. Mary must have died soon after their marriage, for by 1806 he had bought half of Boston Township in Portage County, and had gone there to clear the ground for his farm, and to build a log house for his new bride, Margaret Craig Wolcott. Alfred was a taxpayer in Portage Co. in 1808. This part of Portage County later became Summit County. Alfred was elected Justice of the Peace in the first election, and also serving as a fence-viewer. His old record book containing all cases that came to him as Justice was in the possession of his great-grandson, Oliver Wolcott, of Copley, Ohio. The Wolcott's daughter Malinda was the first white child born in Boston Township. In 1816 a log schoolhouse was built in the Wolcott neighborhood, and Alfred Wolcott was the first schoolmaster. It is said that there was a tiny school near his home in which he taught as early as 1812. Alfred served in Capt. Rial McArthur's Co. from August to October 1812, during the War of 1812. His will left his land, about 119 acres, to his wife, Margaret, with the exception of a half acre left as a burial ground for the township of Boston, now called the Fairview Cemetery, established in 1890.
m. 27 MAY 1806 Youngstown, Trumbull Co., Ohio, Margaret Craig, b. 1785 Wheeling, Ohio Co., West Virginia, d. 28 FEB 1863 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
8 children: Malinda, Edytha, Parmenio, Alfred, Josiah, Darius, Mary, Simon Perkins.
(7) Malinda Wolcott7 (Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 APR 1807 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1878 .
m. 9 OCT 1828 Hudson, Columbia Co., New York, John Sherman Oviatt, b. 18 JUL 1805 Goshen, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 1861 .
Spouse NotesJOHN was the grandson of Samuel Oviatt who hired Alfred Wolcott to survey 4,000 acres in the Western Reserve.
(7) Edytha Wolcott7 (Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 OCT 1808 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 12 APR 1878 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
m. 10 JAN 1828 , Portage Co., Ohio, Zebulon Stow, b. 8 APR 1802 Middletown, Middlesex Co., Connecticut, d. 28 SEP 1871 Cascade, Kent Co., Michigan.
5 children: Russel J., Alfred Wolcott, Lucy Abiah, L.C., Laura.
(8) Russel J. Stow8 (Edytha Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 6 AUG 1837 , Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
NotesRUSSELL was a table manufacturer at Grand Rapids, Michigan, in 1880, with wife Harriet, and daughter Ella.
m. 27 OCT 1864 Paris Township, Kent Co., Michigan, Harriet H. Henshaw, b. 1 OCT 1846 , Summit Co., Ohio, d. 31 MAY 1918 .
(8) Alfred Wolcott Stow8 (Edytha Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1838 , Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. 8 FEB 1862 Cascade, Kent Co., Michigan, Clara Augusta Beckley, b. 28 AUG 1841 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 18 MAR 1910 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
(8) Lucy Abiah Stow8 (Edytha Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 DEC 1841 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 9 FEB 1904 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
m. 17 DEC 1863 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio, William Bellamy, b. 11 AUG 1839 London,, England, d. 18 NOV 1905 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
(8) L.C. Stow8 (Edytha Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 JAN 1847 Stow, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 9 JAN 1922 Greeley, Weld Co., Colorado.
m. Mary Francis Teeple, b. 31 JUL 1845 Cascade, Kent Co., Michigan, d. 23 JUN 1910 Greeley, Weld Co., Colorado.
(8) Laura Stow8 (Edytha Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 JAN 1849 Stowe, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 27 APR 1937 .
m. 16 APR 1868 Franklin Patterson, b. 5 DEC 1844 , d. .
(7) Parmenio Wolcott7 (Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 MAY 1810 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 17 JUL 1871 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesPARMENIO was a farmer. He was a town trustee of Norfolk, Ohio, from 1862 to 1871. In 1870 Parmenio was at Northfield, Summit Co., Ohio, with Emeline and James M. Wolcott. He purchased a house and land in Summit Co., Ohio, from George Thompson in 1853. It was a stone farmhouse in the Greek Revival style and is now on the Ohio Historic Registry. Three generations of Wolcotts lived here, and operated a cheese factory on the property. It was owned by his son, James, who deeded it to Avis G. Wolcott in 1898. Avis sold it to Henry E. Bourne in 1913.
m. 10 JUN 1835 , Portage Co., Ohio, Emeline Tupper, b. 27 MAY 1815 Parishville, St. Lawrence Co., New York, d. 27 JUN 1894 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesEMELINE lived with her son, James, in 1880.
6 children: Malinda, Alfred Newton, Phoebe Lorette, James Monroe, Daniel, Margaret Lucinda.
(8) Malinda Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 DEC 1838 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1907 .
m. 2 JUL 1857 , Summit Co., Ohio, Sylvester P. Ozmun, b. , d. .
(8) Malinda Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 DEC 1838 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1907 .
m. Alonzo Schaick, b. 1849 , d. DEC 1890 .
(8) Alfred Newton Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 8 MAY 1840 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. FEB 1893 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
Notes1870 Boston OH:
1870 Boston OH:
Alfred A Woolcott M 30y, farmer
Mary Woolcott F 26y
Elzada Woolcott F 5y
Hebert Woolcott M 4y

Alfred N. Wolcott, 40, born Connecticut, was a carpenter at Boston, Ohio, in 1880. With him was Nellie 35, Eloada 16, Herbert 13, Alice 9, Ara 6, and Arthur 6, all born Ohio.
m. 31 DEC 1863 ,, Ohio, Ella A. "Nellie" Wells, b. 1 JAN 1845 Bedford, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 25 MAR 1900 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(8) Phoebe Lorette Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 JAN 1843 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 7 NOV 1920 .
m. 4 JAN 1863 , Summit Co., Ohio, Louis Gay, b. 17 APR 1839 Bedford, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. .
Spouse NotesLOUIS was a farmer at Bedford, Ohio, in 1880.
(8) James Monroe Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 AUG 1845 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 15 AUG 1892 , Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesJAMES was a farmer in Summit Co., Ohio. He took over his father's farm. In 1880 he was a farmer at Northampton Township, Summit Co., Ohio, with wife Avis 27 and mother Emeline 65. His wife sold the farm in 1913 to the Presbyterian Church, who established a "fresh air camp", known as the Goodrich Social Settlement there.
m. 1880 Northfield-Macedonia Cemetery, Northfield, Summit Co., Ohio, Avis Gertrude Phyle, b. 25 FEB 1852 Macedonia, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 2 APR 1931 Bedford, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(8) Daniel Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1847 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
(8) Margaret Lucinda Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 AUG 1862 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. 17 FEB 1880 , Summit Co., Ohio, Henry Jones, b. , d. .
(7) Alfred Wolcott7 (Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 JAN 1812 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 17 MAR 1892 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
NotesALFRED and his 15 year old wife set up housekeeping in a log cabin on his father's farm at Boston Township, Ohio. The log cabin was replaced by a large farm house, and was expanded into a four hundred acre farm. Alfred served several terms in the Ohio legislature, and he saw to it that those of his children who wished it had a college education and professional training. In 1880 he was at Boston, Ohio, with Mary Ann, John, Anna A., Alfred, and Fremont Wolcott. His farm is now the Boston Mills Golf Course.
m. 18 APR 1831 Mary Ann Scoville, b. 1816 ,, Connecticut, d. 23 JUN 1882 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesMARY came to Hudson, Ohio, with her mother.
11 children: Simon Perkins, Andrew Augustus, George Young, Andrew Augustus, Darius Young, Lucinda Marie, Thomas Darius, John Mead, Anna Augusta, Alfred E., Fremont Charles.
(8) Simon Perkins Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 JAN 1837 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 6 APR 1901 Kent, Portage Co., Ohio.
NotesSIMON graduated from Western Reserve College with an AM degree in 1862. He studied law at Hudson and Akron, Ohio, and was admitted to the bar in Summit County in 1864. He moved to Kent, Ohio, in 1867, where he was an attorney for the Atlantic & Great Western Railroad. In 1870 he was at Franklin, Portage Co., Ohio, with Mary, Nellie, and Jennie Wolcott. He was a personal friend of Presidents McKinley and Garfield. He was City Solicitor for Kent for two terms, a member of the school board for nine years, and a member of the Board of Examiners. For 9 years he was Deputy State Supervisor of Elections for Portage County. Simon was said to have been a great orator. He was elected Mayor of Kent in 1866, and was elected to the Ohio State Senate in 1881 as a Republican, and reelected in 1883. He built a house at 450 West Main St. in Kent, Ohio, in 1869.
m. 17 JUL 1866 Hudson, Summit Co., Ohio, Mary Helen Brewster, b. 29 DEC 1841 Hudson, Summit Co., Ohio, d. JAN 1910 Kent, Portage Co., Ohio.
(8) Andrew Augustus Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 JAN 1839 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 8 DEC 1841 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(8) George Young Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 FEB 1841 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 27 FEB 1841 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(8) Andrew Augustus Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 FEB 1842 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 11 MAY 1862 Strasburg, Shenadoah Co., Virginia.
NotesANDREW enlisted in Co. D, 29th Ohio Inf. Regt. from Summit, Ohio. He also served in Co. H., 20th Ohio Infantry Regt. He died during the war at Strasburg, Virginia. His epitaph says he "died for his country."
(8) Darius Young Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 MAY 1845 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 12 AUG 1849 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(8) Lucinda Marie Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 JUL 1847 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 9 AUG 1849 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(8) Thomas Darius Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 JUL 1850 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 11 AUG 1854 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(8) John Mead Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 APR 1853 Hudson, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 1939 Washington, District of Columbia.
NotesJOHN learned to play the drum at age nine, and left home to join his brother, Andrew, who was in the army at Cleveland. His brother put him on the train and sent him home. He attended Western Reserve College, and at age 21 went to Grand Rapids, Michigan, to be a travelling salesman for a furniture manyfacturer. He and his wife lived with her parents at Grand Rapids in 1880. John moved to Washington, D.C., for his wife's health, and went to work for the Post Office, and later the Department of Commerse. He worked for the government for 25 years. He served in the U.S. Navy in both World War I and II. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1917, and was District of Columbia state vice president of the Wolcott Society.

1910 Washington DC

1920 Washington DC
m. 16 OCT 1878 Ada, Kent Co., Michigan, Rose Arabella Woodworth, b. 1855 Ada, Kent Co., Michigan, d. 1931 Washington, District of Columbia.
(8) Anna Augusta Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 FEB 1856 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
(8) Alfred E. Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 MAR 1858 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 8 MAR 1908 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
NotesALFRED was a lawyer and a judge at Grand Rapids, Michigan. In 1888 he was a Circuit Court Commissioner. He was a two term Prosecuting Attorney from Kent Co., Michigan in 1892, and from 1900 to 1908 a Circuit Judge of 17th Judicial District of Michigan. He was the first Juvenile Court Judge in the State of Michigan. At the time of his death he was a judge of the Superior Court at Grand Rapids. He was prominent in securing indeterminate sentence laws and parole.

In 1900 he was a curcuit judge at Grand Rapids with Carrie B., Mabel L., and Hazel C. Wolcott.

He gave the principal speech at the third Wolcott reunion at Warren, Ohio, in 1907, and was elected the second President of the Society in that year.
m. 21 OCT 1885 Akron, Summit Co., Ohio, Carrie B. Hauk, b. 17 JUN 1858 Suffield, Portage Co., Ohio, d. 10 NOV 1943 Bluffton, Allen Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesCARRIE was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914 residing at Grand Rapids, Michigan.
(8) Fremont Charles Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 MAY 1863 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 10 AUG 1895 Canton, Stark Co., Ohio.
NotesFREMONT was a farmer in Summit Co., Ohio. He inherited the family homestead. He moved from Boston to Canton, Ohio in 1892. When he died in 1895, his family moved to Akron.

1910 Akron OH
Metta Walcott 44, b. OH
Lena F Wolcott 23, b. OH, stenographer
Olivar H Wolcott 21, b. OH, clerk, rubber factory
Kenneth W Wolcott 17, b. OH
Mary P Wolcott 15, b. OH
m. 25 NOV 1885 , Summit Co., Ohio, Metta E. "Mettie" Hand, b. 17 JAN 1866 Fairlawn, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 29 MAY 1936 Akron, Summit Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesMETTA wrote poetry. Sh was probably Marietta Hand, born 1866, daughter f W. H. Hand 47, market gardner born New York, and Mary Hand 45 born Ireland, who were at Portage, Summit Co., Ohio in 1880. She attended the 1914 Wolcott reunion at Cleveland, Ohio, with her children, Oliver, Kenneth and Mary.
(7) Josiah Wolcott7 (Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 FEB 1814 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 15 MAR 1828 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio.
(7) Darius Wolcott7 (Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 DEC 1816 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 29 AUG 1894 Thompson, Geauga Co., Ohio.
NotesDARIUS and Sophia were at Thompson, Ohio, in 1870. He was appointed a Justice of the Peace at Thompson in 1873. He was a farmer at Thompson, Ohio, in 1880. Buried with him and his wife at Maple Grove Cemetery was Minnie Wolcott, possibly a daughter.
m. 30 APR 1841 , Lorain Co., Ohio, Sophia Simpson, b. 1819 ,, New York, d. 1 OCT 1890 Thompson, Geauga Co., Ohio.
2 children: Mary, Addie.

(7) Mary Wolcott7 (Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 AUG 1819 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. .
m. 4 JUL 1838 , Portage Co., Ohio, Eli Gaylord, b. 1816 ,, Ohio, d. .
Spouse NotesELI was a farmer at Stow, Ohio, in 1880, with wife Mary W..
(7) Simon Perkins Wolcott7 (Alfred Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 AUG 1821 Boston Township, Summit Co., Ohio, d. 26 OCT 1821 Boston, Summit Co., Ohio.
(6) Parmenio Wolcott6 (Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 DEC 1770 Rome, Oneida Co., New York, d. ,, New York.
NotesPARMENIO Wolcott, Jr., of Cayuga County, served as ensign in Capt. Ellis' Co., New York militia, in 1810-1812. He was later a farmer at Yorkshire, Cattaraugus Co., New York. In 1840 he moved to Michigan, buying land in Washtenaw and Barry Counties, and living in Washtenaw County. He later returned to New York and resided with his son, Alfred.
m. 9 AUG 1798 Westmoreland, Oneida Co., New York, Anna "Annie" Fulkerson, b. 1779 Freehold, Monmouth Co., New Jersey, d. 24 JUL 1874 Orangeville, Barry Co., Michigan.
Spouse NotesANNA was with her son, Alfred, at Orangeville, Michigan, in 1870. Anna Wolcott, widow, died 1874, Orangeville, Michigan, age 97 years, 8 mo., 10 days.
8 children: Lydia, Laura, Littoria, Alfred, Henry "Harry", Parmenio, Samuel B., Clarinda Matilda.
(7) Lydia Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 APR 1799 ,, New York, d. APR 1870 , Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
m. DEC 1819 Nicholas Rowe, b. 8 NOV 1778 , Dutchess Co., New York, d. 11 OCT 1841 , Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
(7) Laura Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 JUL 1801 Albany, Albany Co., New York, d. FEB 1861 .
m. 29 NOV 1821 Worcester, Otsego Co., New York, Stephen Vanrensselaer Freeman, b. 25 APR 1801 Albany, Albany Co., New York, d. 10 MAR 1877 LaGrange, Lorain Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesStephen was a carpenter.
10 children: Parmenio Vanrensselaer, Lydia Ann, Dorliska J., George E., Coroden W., Ellen M., Stephen E., Laura Seville, Susan Dorliska, Casius M..

(7) Littoria Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 FEB 1804 ,, New York, d. .
m. 19 DEC 1829 Henry Allen, b. , d. .
(7) Alfred Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 JUN 1806 , Tompkins Co., New York, d. LaGrange, Lorain Co., Ohio.
NotesALFRED moved from Tompkins County, New York, to Erie County in 1840, where he had a hotel and a farm. He then had a hotel at Cattaraugus county, New York, for 10 years. He was a farmer at Prairieville, Michigan, in 1850. He was a farmer at Orangeville, Michigan, in 1860, with Mary and Anna, his mother. He was at Prairieville, Michigan in 1870 with Mary H. and Anne. He moved to join his son, William, at La Grange and in 1880 was farming at LaGrange, Ohio.
m. 20 MAR 1834 Mary Henrietta Ledoyt, b. 1834 ,, Connecticut, d. .
1 children: William Franklin.
(8) William Franklin Wolcott8 (Alfred Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 JAN 1835 LaGrange, Lorain Co., Ohio, d. 9 APR 1922 LaGrange, Lorain Co., Ohio.
NotesWILLIAM came to Lorain Co., Ohio, at age 18 and settled at La Grange . About 1859 went to Michigan but didn't like it there and returned to Ohio. He was at Orangeville, Ohio, in 1860, with Melissa and Lewis. He enlisted 25 Aug. 1864 in Btry E, 1st Ohio Lt. Arty. Regt., discharged 10 July 1865. After the war he purchased a hotel which he ran for 10 years. He was at La Grange, Ohio, in 1870 with Melissa, Lewis, and Mary E. Woolcott. He was then a travelling salesman for lightning rods for 5 years. He was a laborer at La Grange, Ohio, in 1880. He was appointed justice of the Peace in 1888. He served as postmaster 1898-1908, and Mayor of LaGrange for 12 years, also city councilman and constable. W. F. Wolcott of LaGrange, Ohio, attended the 1909 Wolcott reunion at Niagara Falls, and was a member in 1914.

William F Wolcott
Birth Date: 15 Jan 1835
Spouse: Malissa Hastings
Marriage Date: 22 Feb 1857
Parents: Alfred and Mary Henrietta Ledoyt
Notes: Civil War Veteran

m. 22 FEB 1857 Melissa Adeline Hastings, b. 1840 ,, Ohio, d. 15 APR 1905 LaGrange, Lorain Co., Ohio.
(7) Henry "Harry" Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 APR 1809 ,, New York, d. ABT 1875 Vevay, Ingham Co., Michigan.
Notes HENRY was a farmer. He and his brother, Parmenio, moved to Washtenaw Co., Michigan, in the 1830s.
In the 1840s he and his brother, Samuel, settled in White Oak Twp. Ingham Co., Michigan. They were on the tax rolls there in 1844.

(7) Parmenio Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 JUL 1813 ,, New York, d. Orangeville, Barry Co., Michigan.
NotesPARMENIO was a farmer. In the 1830's he and his brother, Henry, moved to Washtenaw Co., Michigan. In 1837 Parmenio Wolcott Jr. of Washtenaw Co., Michigan, bought 80 acres of federal land in Washtenaw Co.. In the 1840's he settled in Barry Co., Michigan. He was a farmer at Orangeville, Michigan, in 1850 with Azina and Alfred Woolcott. He was living in Michigan in 1863. In 1860 he was a farmer at Orangeville, Barry Co., Michigan, with Alzina L. and Jerome.
m. 15 JAN 1841 , Jackson Co., Michigan, Alzina L. Turner, b. 1816 ,, New York, d. .
1 children: Alfred Jerome "Jerome".
(8) Alfred Jerome "Jerome" Wolcott8 (Parmenio Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 SEP 1843 Orangeville, Barry Co., Michigan, d. 1912 .
NotesALFRED was a physician.
m. 17 SEP 1868 , Mc Henry Co., Illinois, Anna W. Knapp, b. Bedford, Westchester Co., New York, d. .
(7) Samuel B. Wolcott7 (Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 JUL 1815 ,, New York, d. 16 SEP 1870 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
NotesSAMUEL and his brother, Henry, were among the earliest settlers in White Oak Township, Ingham Co., Michigan. They were on a tax list there in 1844. He was a farmer at Sharon, Washtenaw Co. from 1850 to 1870. In 1860 he was with Marian, Frances, Marian, and Venning.
m. 24 FEB 1849 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, Maria Ellen Matthews, b. 1829 ,, Michigan, d. ABT 1861 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan.
3 children: Frances, Florence, Venning Dodge,
(8) Frances Wolcott8 (Samuel B. Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1862 ,, Michigan, d. .

m. 23 NOV 1875 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, Ansel F. Gillette, b. 1852 ,, Michigan, d. .
Spouse NotesANSEL was a farmer at Tecumseh, Michigan, in 1880.
(8) Venning Dodge Wolcott8 (Samuel B. Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 SEP 1860 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 31 JUL 1929 Battle Creek, Ida Co., Iowa.
NotesVENNING moved from Michigan to Iowa about 1880. He was at Ida, Iowa, in 1885, with Hattie and Fred Wolcott. He owned the Maple Grove Stock Farm. "His farm comprised 155 acres in the vicinity of Battle Creek, Iowa. His house was a story and a half with an L, and he had two barns. Mr. Wolcott made a specialty of fine horses and secured the best breeds of draft horses. His French Draft, "Captain", a black Percheron, weighed 1,850 pounds, and his French coach was a bay of good style and action." He is buried in the same cemetery with Mabel E. Wolcott 1873-1961, and


Birth: Sep. 16, 1860
Death: Jul. 31, 1929

Venning Dodge Wolcott was born in Sharon, Michigan, Sept. 16. 1860, to Samuel and Maria (Matthews) Wolcott, and died in Battle Creek, Iowa, on July 31, 1929, aged 68 years, 10 months, and 15 days.

On April 9, 1880, he came to Battle Creek and continued this residence here for the past 50 years with the exception of 2 years 1895-6 which he spent in Harrison County, Iowa. It was here that he was married to Mabel F. Lawrence of Magnolia, Iowa, on Dec. 2, 1896.

Mr. Wolcott had been ill many years with kidney trouble. Several years ago one kidney had to be removed, but relief was very temporary as his health had been poor ever since.

He was a member of Perserverance Lodge No. 446, A.F. and A.M. Benevolence Chaper No. 336, O.F.S. Sioux City Consistory Chaptr No 5, Scottish Rite Masons and Abu Bekr Temple of Masonic Order, and was faithful to his duties in order.

Mr. Wolcott owned a farm here which was later made into town lots and residences built and has helped make the town.

Funeral Services were held at the Presbyterian Church Friday, August 2, at 2:30 with Rev. Claude Fausnaugh officiating. Burial was in the Mt. Hope Cemetery, Battle Creek.

Survivors include his widow and 4 children, Fred C. of Audubon, Iowa; D. W. Eugene and Gary of Des Moines, Iowa; and Mrs. Lucille Modrell of Battle Creek, and a host of friends.

Burial:
Mount Hope Cemetery
Battle Creek
Ida County
Iowa, USA
m. 1879 , Ingham Co., Michigan, Harriet J. "Hattie" Teel, b. , d. .
(8) Venning Dodge Wolcott8 (Samuel B. Wolcott7, Parmenio Wolcott6, Parmenio Wolcott5, Roger Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 SEP 1860 Sharon, Washtenaw Co., Michigan, d. 31 JUL 1929 Battle Creek, Ida Co., Iowa.
NotesVENNING moved from Michigan to Iowa about 1880. He was at Ida, Iowa, in 1885, with Hattie and Fred Wolcott. He owned the Maple Grove Stock Farm. "His farm comprised 155 acres in the vicinity of Battle Creek, Iowa. His house was a story and a half with an L, and he had two barns. Mr. Wolcott made a specialty of fine horses and secured the best breeds of draft horses. His French Draft, "Captain", a black Percheron, weighed 1,850 pounds, and his French coach was a bay of good style and action." He is buried in the same cemetery with Mabel E. Wolcott 1873-1961, and


Birth: Sep. 16, 1860
Death: Jul. 31, 1929

Venning Dodge Wolcott was born in Sharon, Michigan, Sept. 16. 1860, to Samuel and Maria (Matthews) Wolcott, and died in Battle Creek, Iowa, on July 31, 1929, aged 68 years, 10 months, and 15 days.

On April 9, 1880, he came to Battle Creek and continued this residence here for the past 50 years with the exception of 2 years 1895-6 which he spent in Harrison County, Iowa. It was here that he was married to Mabel F. Lawrence of Magnolia, Iowa, on Dec. 2, 1896.

Mr. Wolcott had been ill many years with kidney trouble. Several years ago one kidney had to be removed, but relief was very temporary as his health had been poor ever since.

He was a member of Perserverance Lodge No. 446, A.F. and A.M. Benevolence Chaper No. 336, O.F.S. Sioux City Consistory Chaptr No 5, Scottish Rite Masons and Abu Bekr Temple of Masonic Order, and was faithful to his duties in order.

Mr. Wolcott owned a farm here which was later made into town lots and residences built and has helped make the town.

Funeral Services were held at the Presbyterian Church Friday, August 2, at 2:30 with Rev. Claude Fausnaugh officiating. Burial was in the Mt. Hope Cemetery, Battle Creek.

Survivors include his widow and 4 children, Fred C. of Audubon, Iowa; D. W. Eugene and Gary of Des Moines, Iowa; and Mrs. Lucille Modrell of Battle Creek, and a host of friends.

Burial:
Mount Hope Cemetery
Battle Creek
Ida County
Iowa, USA
m. 2 DEC 1896 Magnolia, Harrison Co., Iowa, Mabel Emma Lawrence, b. 18 DEC 1873 Magnolia, Harrison Co., Iowa, d. 23 AUG 1961 Battle Creek, Ida Co., Iowa.
