Spouse NotesJOHN was a judge.
(7) Ellsworth7 (Sophia Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1825 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. ABT 1825 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(7) Henry Martin Ellsworth7 (Sophia Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 APR 1827 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 21 OCT 1829 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Ursula Wolcott6 (Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 NOV 1788 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 JUN 1868 .
NotesURSULA lived at East Windsor, Connecticut, in 1840.
m. 10 MAY 1815 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Newton Skinner, b. 10 OCT 1782 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 MAR 1825 New Britain, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesNEWTON graduated from Yale University in 1804. He was pastor of the New Britain Congregational Church. He lived at East Windsor, Connecticut, in 1840.
3 children: Mary Gay, Samuel Wolcott, Ann Grant.
(7) Mary Gay Skinner7 (Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 FEB 1818 New Britain, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 26 OCT 1898 .
m. 6 OCT 1840 Aaron Russell Livermore, b. 6 OCT 1810 Mansfield, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. East Haven, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesAARON attended Amhurst College 1833-1836, and Lane Theological Seminary in 1837. He graduated from the East Windsor Hill Theological Seminary in 1839. He was a clergyman at East Haven, Connecticut, in 1880, age 70, with wife, Mary G. 62, and daughter, Mary C. 29
3 children: Russell Wolcott, Charles Herbert, Mary H..
(8) Russell Wolcott Livermore8 (Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 FEB 1849 Mansfield, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 21 APR 1914 Pates, Robeson Co., North Carolina.
NotesRUSSELL received a BA degreee from the Massachusetts Agricultural College in 1872 and graduated from the Yale School of Lawe in 1875. He was a lawyer at New Haven for 2 years and then moved to Toledo, Ohio, where he practiced law for 6 years. He then moved to North Carolina to assist his wife's brother, and settled at Pates where he was a cotton planter, merchant, and dealer in turpentine and naval supplies.
m. 5 MAY 1880 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, Elizabeth Taylor Hayes, b. , d. .
(8) Charles Herbert Livermore8 (Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 OCT 1856 Mansfield, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 20 OCT 1928 Monterey, Monterey Co., California.
NotesCHARLES received a BA degree from Yale in 1879; was teacher and principal of Guilford Institute, Guilford, Connecticut, 1879-1883. He received his PhD. from of Johns Hopkins University in 1886. He was a university fellow in history, 1884-1885; instructor in History and German at Hopkins Grammar School, New Haven, Connecticut, 1885-1886; instructor in History at the University of California, 1886-1888; Professor of History at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Boston, 1888-1893; Principal of Adelphia Academy, Brooklyn, New York, 1893-1896 and elected President of Adelphi College in 1896. He was the winner of $50,000 for the Bok Peace Prize in 1924.
m. Mettie Norton Tuttle, b. , d. .
(8) Mary H. Livermore8 (Mary Gay Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1851 ,, Connecticut, d. .
NotesMARY was a school teacher, living with her parents at East Haven, Connecticut, in 1880. She lived at Hartford, Connecticut, in 1918.
(7) Samuel Wolcott Skinner7 (Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 JUN 1820 New Britain, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 16 AUG 1903 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio.
NotesSAMUEL received a BA degree from Yale College in 1842 and a MA degree in 1846. He was liscenced as a medical doctor in 1846. He was Divison Surgeon with the 1st Connecticut Artillery at Arlington Virginia, from 1861 to 1865, during the Civil War. In 1866 he moved to Toledo, Ohio, where he had a medical practice. He served as the Toledo Health Officer and consulting surgeon for St. Vincent Hospital.
m. 16 SEP 1846 Dorianna Fuller, b. 18 OCT 1823 , d. 17 MAR 1919 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio.
5 children: Helen Wolcott, Alice Fuller, Edward Bissell, Roger Wolcott, Samuel Wolcott.
(8) Helen Wolcott Skinner8 (Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 SEP 1847 , d. 8 JUN 1935 .
m. 2 JUN 1875 Charles M. Dimmick, b. , d. .
(8) Alice Fuller Skinner8 (Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 FEB 1849 Windsor Locks, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 MAR 1919 .
m. 6 OCT 1868 Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, John Hardy Doyle, b. 23 APR 1844 Mundy Creek, Perry Co., Ohio, d. 24 MAR 1919 Mundy Creek, Perry Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesJOHN attended Dennison University in Toledo, Ohio. He was admitted to the Ohio bar in 1864, and practiced law in Toledo, He was elected District Judge in 1879. In 1883 he was appointed to the Ohio Supreme Court, serving for one year.
(8) Edward Bissell Skinner8 (Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 FEB 1852 , d. 1 MAY 1929 .
NotesEDWARD was a bookkeeper for MacLaren & Sprague.
m. 10 JAN 1877 Rose S. Jones, b. 13 MAR 1855 , d. 4 JUN 1933 .
(8) Roger Wolcott Skinner8 (Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 MAY 1857 , d. 24 MAY 1857 .
(8) Samuel Wolcott Skinner8 (Samuel Wolcott Skinner7, Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 8 OCT 1861 , d. 25 SEP 1891 .
NotesSamuel was bookeeper for the Milburn Wagon Works at Toledo.
m. 10 JUN 1890 Lillian Bishop, b. , d. .
(7) Ann Grant Skinner7 (Ursula Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 AUG 1823 New Britain, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JUN 1893 .
m. 19 OCT 1848 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Sylvester Hine, b. , d. .
(6) Elizabeth Wolcott6 (Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 SEP 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 7 FEB 1873 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. 23 NOV 1820 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Erastus Ellsworth, b. 20 JAN 1790 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 APR 1879 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesERASTUS was a merchant and an elder in the Presbyterian Church in New York City. He purchased a home at East Windsor from his brother-in-law, Elihu Wolcott. He was a founder of the Theological Institute of Connecticut.
5 children: Erastus Wolcott, Elizabeth, , Mary Lyman, Josiah Leavitt.
(7) Erastus Wolcott Ellsworth7 (Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 NOV 1822 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 5 JAN 1902 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesERASTUS graduated from Amhurst College in 1844 and studied law but was never admitted to the bar. He was a poet and an inventor. In 1845 he obtained a patent for a drawing or copying instrument, and for a device for making a siphon discharge at its highest point. One of his poems, "What is the Use", was published in "An American Anthology", by Edmund Steadman. Erastus engraved some of the pictures that appeared in "The Wolcott Memorial".
(7) Elizabeth Ellsworth7 (Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 APR 1824 New York City, New York, d. 7 DEC 1825 New York City, New York.
(7) Ellsworth7 (Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1826 New York City, New York, d. INFANT .
(7) Mary Lyman Ellsworth7 (Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 NOV 1827 New York City, New York, d. .
m. 9 NOV 1848 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, William Wood, b. ABT 1823 Waterbury, New Haven Co., Connecticut, d. 9 AUG 1884 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesWILLIAM was a medical doctor. He was also an ornithologist, and the author of "The Birds of Connecticut".
2 children: Elizabeth Ellsworth, William Russell.
(8) Elizabeth Ellsworth Wood8 (Mary Lyman Ellsworth7, Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 AUG 1849 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 9 NOV 1878 Lewis Sperry, b. 23 JAN 1848 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(8) William Russell Wood8 (Mary Lyman Ellsworth7, Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 JUN 1859 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
(7) Josiah Leavitt Ellsworth7 (Elizabeth Wolcott6, Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 MAY 1829 New York City, New York, d. 25 APR 1832 New York City, New York.
(6) Horace Wolcott6 (Jerusha Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 MAR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1838 , Morgan Co., Illinois.
NotesHORACE was Captain of a cavalry unit at South Windsor. He moved first to Michigan, where he was a petitioner at Monroe Co. in 1831 and 1834, and later to Illinois, where he died. Horace Wolcott of Hartford Co., Connecticut purchased 279 acres of government land at Lenawee Co., Michigan, in 1825, where he was a fur trader. Horace Wolcott of Monroe Co., Michigan, purchased 3 acres of land at Wayne Co., Michigan, in 1825. An additional patent for 80 acres of land in Lenawee Co., issued in 1825, was confirmed in 1931. His brother, Elihu, was administrator of his estate.
(5) Arodi Wolcott5 (Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 SEP 1760 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 18 MAY 1805 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. DEC 1789 , Hartford Co., Connecticut, Ruth Pitkin, b. 1764 East Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 AUG 1811 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: Arodi Pitkin, Almira, , Mary.
(6) Arodi Pitkin Wolcott6 (Arodi Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 JUN 1791 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 DEC 1842 .
(6) Almira Wolcott6 (Arodi Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 AUG 1793 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 25 FEB 1865 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
NotesALMIRA's grave stone says she died 27 Feb. 1865, age 71. She and her sister, Mary, raised Julia, daughter of Simon and Betsy Loomis of South Windsor. Julia married Zenas Rider of Springfield, Massachusetts.
(6) Wolcott6 (Arodi Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 DEC 1795 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 DEC 1795 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Mary Wolcott6 (Arodi Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 APR 1797 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 MAR 1858 South Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. Russell Cone, b. , d. .
(5) Albert Wolcott5 (Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 DEC 1761 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesALBERT lived in the home built by his grandfather, Gov. Roger Wolcott, in 1704. He was at East Windsor, Connecticut in 1790, with a family of 1 male over 16, 1 male under 16, and 4 females. He was at Hartford Co. in 1810 with 1 male over 45 (Albert), 2 females 16-25 (Hannah & Cynthia), and 1 female 10-15 (Elizabeth). Following the death of his wife and only son, Albert and his four daughters, Cynthia, Hannah, Laura, and Elizabeth, moved to Cleveland, Ohio, in 1816. He brought with him the family Bible of his grandfather, Gov. Roger Wolcott, which was later deposited by his grandson, Stoughton Bliss, with the the Hartford, Connecticut, museum.
m. 26 APR 1786 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Hannah Loomis, b. 29 JUL 1765 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 11 JAN 1807 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
6 children: Hannah, Albert, Cynthia, Laura, Laura, Elizabeth "Betsey".
(6) Hannah Wolcott6 (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 MAY 1786 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 10 MAY 1855 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(6) Albert Wolcott6 (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 NOV 1787 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 MAR 1810 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
m. Hannah Moore, b. ABT 1790 , d. ABT 1832 .
Spouse NotesHANNAH's grave stone says she died age 42; the date is unreadable.
(6) Cynthia Wolcott6 (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 SEP 1789 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1848 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
m. 16 MAY 1813 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, William Bliss, b. 3 JAN 1790 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 8 SEP 1828 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesWILLIAM and his wife moved to Cleveland, Ohio, in 1815. He is considered the city's first silversmith. He also sold general goods and worked as a cabinet maker. He owned considerable property in Cleveland. They lived on Superior St., near West 3rd. Her father and sisters lived nearby. The Blisses were charter members of the Old Stone Church in Cleveland, Ohio. He died of malaria.
5 children: Albert Wolcott, Nancy Eliza, Louisa, Stoughton, William Samuel,
(7) Albert Wolcott Bliss7 (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 8 MAR 1814 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 NOV 1849 Warren, Trumbull Co., Ohio.
m. 6 AUG 1846 Maria Harsh, b. , d. .
1 children: Albert Harsh.
(8) Albert Harsh Bliss8 (Albert Wolcott Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 JUL 1847 Warren, Trumbull Co., Ohio, d. 1 FEB 1852 .
(7) Nancy Eliza Bliss7 (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 JAN 1817 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 17 SEP 1842 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(7) Louisa Bliss7 (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUN 1819 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. .
NotesLOUISA was born blind, and after her father's death was cared for by a cousin, Nancy Warner, Mrs. Proctor Pease, living in Michigan.
(7) Stoughton Bliss7 (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 FEB 1823 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesSTOUGHTON remained unmarried after the death of his wife. He lived at the Kennard House hotel at Cleveland. He is said to have strongly resembled Oliver Wolcott, signer of the Declaration of Independence.
m. 1849 Maria Ann Sweet, b. 1826 Buffalo, Columbia Co., New York, d. 1850 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(7) William Samuel Bliss7 (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 MAY 1827 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 1881 Glenville, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesSAMUEL moved from Columbia, Tennessee, to Cleveland, Ohio, in 1872. In 1880 he was a newspaper publisher at Franklin, Indiana, but returned to Ohio where he died in 1881.
m. 17 DEC 1851 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, Lucy A. Gurley, b. , d. .
1 children: Lizzie.
(8) Lizzie Bliss8 (William Samuel Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 SEP 1852 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 28 NOV 1852 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(7) William Samuel Bliss7 (Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 MAY 1827 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 1881 Glenville, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesSAMUEL moved from Columbia, Tennessee, to Cleveland, Ohio, in 1872. In 1880 he was a newspaper publisher at Franklin, Indiana, but returned to Ohio where he died in 1881.
m. 1865 Anna Maria Johnson, b. 1840 Stroupsville, Trumbull Co., Ohio, d. 1926 Berea, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
2 children: Harry Alfred, Maria Louise.
(8) Harry Alfred Bliss8 (William Samuel Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 AUG 1867 Columbia, Maury Co., Tennessee, d. 11 DEC 1937 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
NotesHARRY was an amateur musician and played several instruments. He played at many affairs in the Cleveland area. He was President of the Bliss Supply Co. Mrs. Harry A. Bliss of Cleveland attended the 1914 Wolcott reunion, but the Blisses are not listed on the Society membership list until 1917. Harry was Ohio state vice president in 1918, and the 14th President of the Society of Descendants of Henry Wolcot, 1925-26.
m. 31 AUG 1910 L. Blanche "Blanche" Fisher, b. 11 AUG 1879 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio, d. 1953 Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(8) Maria Louise Bliss8 (William Samuel Bliss7, Cynthia Wolcott6, Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 JUL 1871 Columbia, Maury Co., Tennessee, d. .
NotesMARIA lived at LaGrange, Illinois.
m. 28 MAR 1894 Wellington, Lorain Co., Ohio, Charles Phelps Horr, b. 20 JAN 1868 Lorain, Lorain Co., Ohio, d. 14 MAR 1936 La Grange, Cook Co., Illinois.
(6) Laura Wolcott6 (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 MAR 1793 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 20 SEP 1793 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Laura Wolcott6 (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 NOV 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 24 DEC 1795 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
(6) Elizabeth "Betsey" Wolcott6 (Albert Wolcott5, Erastus Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 OCT 1797 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. Cleveland, Cuyahoga Co., Ohio.
(4) Ursula Wolcott4 (Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 OCT 1724 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 5 APR 1788 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
NotesURSULA was pictured in Ripley's "Believe It or Not" newspaper column because her father, brother, husband, son, and nephew were all Governors.
m. 10 NOV 1743 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Matthew Griswold, b. 25 MAR 1714 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 28 APR 1799 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesMATTHEW was a lawyer. He was a Representative to the General Assembly in 1759, and appointed Judge of the Superior Court in 1766. In 1769 he was elected Lieutenant Governor and Chief Justice of Connecticut. He served as Governor of Connecticut from 1784 until 1786, and was President of the state Convention for the adoption of the new Federal Constitution in 1788. He lived in the family home called Black Hall. Her eight daughter were sometimes known as "The Black Hall Boys".
8 children: Ursula, Hannah, Marian, John, Ursula, Matthew, Roger, Sally,
(5) Ursula Griswold5 (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 NOV 1744 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 14 FEB 1745 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
(5) Hannah Griswold5 (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1746 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 15 DEC 1755 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
(5) Marian Griswold5 (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1750 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 17 JUN 1829 West Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesMARIAN was considered a very beautiful, brilliant and outspoken woman. When Justin Ely, who became her 3rd husband, proposed marriage she replied, "Oh, I could not think of burying another husband." She died 12 years after him. Account books of the store and farm at Woodstock, Connecticut begun by her first husband were kept by Marion until 1811.
m. 28 SEP 1769 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, Charles Church Chandler, b. 11 JAN 1746 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 9 AUG 1787 Woodstock, Windham Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesCHARLES graduated from Harvard College in 1763. He was a lawyer and member of the Committee of Correspondence and the Continental Congress. He had a store and farm at Woodstock, Massachusetts.
9 children: Dorothy Church, Samuel, Marion, Ursula, Charles, Hannah, Sally, Esther, Elizabeth.

(5) Marian Griswold5 (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1750 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 17 JUN 1829 West Springfield, Hampden Co., Massachusetts.
NotesMARIAN was considered a very beautiful, brilliant and outspoken woman. When Justin Ely, who became her 3rd husband, proposed marriage she replied, "Oh, I could not think of burying another husband." She died 12 years after him. Account books of the store and farm at Woodstock, Connecticut begun by her first husband were kept by Marion until 1811.
m. ABT 1790 Ebenezer Lane, b. 10 FEB 1747 Attleboro, Bristol Co., Massachusetts, d. 21 JUN 1806 .
1 children: Ebenezer.
(6) Ebenezer Lane6 (Marian Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 SEP 1793 Northampton, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 JUN 1866 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio.
NotesEBENEZER was Chief Justice of Ohio.

Ebenezer and Frances were first cousins.

NotesWOLCOTT graduated from Yale University with a degree in law in 1888. He was a lawyer and argued before the New York Surogate Court. He was one of the Executors of the will of William Augustus Spencer who died in the sinking of the Titanic in 1912, as well as executor for Williams brother, Lorrilard Spencer. His transcripts of the papers of Roger Griswold are in the Connecticut Historical Society.

m. 28 MAR 1802 New London, New London Co., Connecticut, Jacob Baker Gurley, b. 2 AUG 1771 Mansfield, Tolland Co., Connecticut, d. 24 SEP 1856 New London, New London Co., Connecticut.
Spouse Notes Jacob B. Gurley, Esq., pf New London, Conn., w'as born in the town of Mansfield, Tolland Co., Conn., Aug. 2, 1771 (house shows by photo.). He attended the common schools of the town, and graduated at Dartmouth College in 1793. He was principal or preceptor of the Union School at New London, studied law, and was admitted to the bar in 1797, and became one of the ablest lawyers in New London County. Mr. Gurley was one of the incorporators of the Savings Bank at New London, 1827. He was a public spirited man, and did much for the advancement of the town and city. Soon after the death of his father, he became the owner of the homestead, which he owned the remainder of his life, and rented it during these years to his son-in-law, Mr. An- son Turner. After the death of Mr. Gurley this farm came into the pos- session of his son-in-law, Mr. Charles A. Gurley, who kept it but a few years, and then sold it. This farm had been in the possession of the Gurleys for over a century, and is situated a little south of the old Gurley burying-ground. Charles Griswold Gurley, son of Jacob B. Gurley, Esq., graduated at Yale College, 1827, and died July 4, 1828.
11 children: Charles, Sarah, Mary Brainard, Charles, Elizabeth, Ursula Wolcott, Hannah Brigham, John Griswold, Ellen, Lydia Ann, Ann.

m. John Lyon Gardiner, b. 1770 , d. 1816 .
Spouse NotesJOHN was 7th lord of the manor of Gardiner's Island, the only entailed estate in America. His father died when he was 4 years old and his uncle, Abraham Gardiner was his guardian until he came of age in 1791.

He was one of the Executors of the will of William Augustus Spencer who died in the sinking of the Titanic in 1912, as well as executor for Williams brother, Lorrilard Spencer. His transcripts of the papers of Roger Griswold are in the Connecticut Historical Society.
(8) Charles Chandler Griswold Lane8 (Elizabeth Diodate Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 DEC 1867 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio, d. 7 MAY 1896 ,, New York.
(7) Sarah Johnson Griswold7 (Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 MAY 1827 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 30 JUN 1847 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, Lorillard Spencer, b. 1826 New York City, New York, d. 1888 Paris, Seine, France.
7 children: Elvira, William Augustus, George Griswold, Charles, Eleanora, Lydia, Lorillard.
(8) Elvira Spencer8 (Sarah Johnson Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1850 ,, New York, d. .
(8) William Augustus Spencer8 (Sarah Johnson Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 JAN 1855 New York City, New York, d. 15 APR 1912 North Bolton Cemetery, North Bolton, Tolland Co., Connecticut.
NotesWILLIAM was raised and educated in Europe. He became a New York socialite and bibliophile. He and his wife Marie boarded the "Titanic" as 1st Class Passenger at Cherbough on Wednesday April 10th, 1912. They had ticket No. 17569, cost 146 10s 10d, and Cabin No. B78. Marie survied the sinking in boat 6 and was picked up by the "Carpathia" and disembarked at New York City on Thursday, April 18th, 1912.

"William Augustus Spencer, who was drowned when the Titanic sank on April 15,1912, left a net estate of $2,218,650, according to an appraisal filed yesterday. The beneficiaries are Mrs. Marie Eugenie Spencer, his widow, $1,273,071; Lorillard Spencer, his nephew, $396,683; the New York Public Library, $394,095; and Eleanora L. S. Cenci, Princess de Vicovaro, his sister, $50,000. Mr. Spencer's estate was made up of these assets: Real estate, $893,622; bank accounts, $122,200; household goods, furniture, books, and pictures at his Throgs Neck Farm in the Bronx, $1,088; a half share in a ruby ring, $2,500; bonds and mortgages, $332,085; stocks and bonds, $932,016, and commissions due as the executor of other estates, $48,573. A claim for $2,670 against the owners of the Titanic for personal property which went down with the steamer was appraised at not more than $500. Included in Mr. Spencer's bequest to the New York Public Library was a library composed chiefly of French books. These were appraised at $40,779. Some of the volumes were: "Une Femme de Qualit au Sicle Pass," by Maurice Leloir, $4,000; "Ftes Galantes," by Paul Verlaine, $2,000; "La Dame de Monsereau," by Alexandre Dumas, $1,500; "La Vengeance des Peaux de Bique," by Gustave Toudouze, $1,400: "The Lady of Shalott," by Alfred Tennyson, $1,000; "La Reliure du XIXe Sicle," by Henri Beraldi, $1,000; "La Tribu Indienne," by Lucien Bonaparte, $1,000; "Pastels Tirages Successifs," by P. Bourget, $1,000; "Histoire d'un Epingle," by Segur, $800; "Jacques le Fataliste et son Maitre," by D. Diderot, $750; "La Mouche," by Alfred de Musset, $720; "Daphnis and Chloe," by Longus, $720; "Les Contes Drolatiques," by Honor de Balzac, $700; "Notre Dame de Paris," by Victor Hugo, $650; "The Three Musketeers," by Alexandre Dumas, $600; and "Zadig ou le Destine," by Voltaire, $600. Mr. Spencer owned this real estate: 183 Water Street, $20,000; 37 Allen Street, $20,500; 395 Grand Street, $30,000; 181-185 Forsyth Street, $66,000; 100 West Seventy-seventh Street, $70,000; 2,046-2,050 Seventh Avenue, $72,000; Throgs Neck Farm, the Bronx, $445,500; Williamsbridge Farm, the Bronx, $240,000; interest in property on Pelham Parkway, the Bronx, $12,400. Mortgages and taxes reduced the net value of the realty to $893,622." New York Times, 10 July 1914.
m. Marie Eugenie , b. 1867 Paris, Seine, France, d. 26 OCT 1913 Paris, Seine, France.
(8) George Griswold Spencer8 (Sarah Johnson Griswold7, Charles Chandler Griswold6, John Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1856 New York City, New York, d. .

m. ABT 3 OCT 1882 Caroline Suydam Berryman, b. 28 DEC 1861 New Haven, New Haven Co., Connecticut, d. 6 APR 1948 Newport, Newport Co., Rhode Island.
(5) Ursula Griswold5 (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 APR 1754 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 27 NOV 1781 .
m. 22 NOV 1777 Lynde McCurdy, b. 4 APR 1755 , d. NOV 1804 .
2 children: Ursula, John.
(6) Ursula McCurdy6 (Ursula Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 AUG 1778 , d. ABT 1819 .
m. John Allen, b. 12 JUN 1763 , d. 31 JUL 1812 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesJohn studied law at the Litchfield Law School and was admitted to the bar in 1786. He was a member of the Connecticut House of Representatives 1793-6, and a Representative to Congress 1797-9, a member of the state Council and Supreme Court of Errors 1800-6, after which he practiced law at Litchfield. He was called "Long John Allen", and a poet.
1 children: John,
(7) John Allen7 (Ursula McCurdy6, Ursula Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1802 , d. 1887 Washington, District of Columbia.
NotesJOHN moved from Litchfield to study law at Cleveland, Ohio, under Judge Samuel Cowles, about 1825. He was admitted to the Cleveland bar, and was the last president of the village council. When Cleveland became a city he was mayor and postmaster, state Senator, Representative to Congress, banker, and railroad director.
m. Warren, Trumbull Co., Ohio, Anna Maria Perkins, b. , d. .
Spouse NotesANNA died three months after her marriage.
(7) John Allen7 (Ursula McCurdy6, Ursula Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1802 , d. 1887 Washington, District of Columbia.
NotesJOHN moved from Litchfield to study law at Cleveland, Ohio, under Judge Samuel Cowles, about 1825. He was admitted to the Cleveland bar, and was the last president of the village council. When Cleveland became a city he was mayor and postmaster, state Senator, Representative to Congress, banker, and railroad director.
m. Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, Harriet E. Mather, b. , d. 1887 Washington, District of Columbia.
1 children: Louise.

NotesMATTHEW was Judge of the Supreme Court of Connecticut.
m. 4 SEP 1788 Lydia Ely, b. 12 SEP 1766 , d. .
(5) Roger Griswold5 (Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 MAR 1762 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 25 OCT 1812 Norwich, New London Co., Connecticut.
NotesROGER graduated from Yale College in 1780 and was admitted to the bar in 1783. In 1794 he was elected to Congress to represent Lyme. He served there for ten years. His fight with Representative Matthew Lyon, which led to a physical fight on the floor of the House of Representatives, created quite a stir. He was offered the post of Secretary of War by John Adams, but declined. In 1807 he was appointed a Judge of the Superior Court, and in 1809 was chosen Lieutenant Governor. He was elected Governor of Connecticut in 1811.
m. 27 OCT 1788 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, Fanny Rogers, b. 23 MAR 1767 Norwich, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 27 DEC 1863 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
11 children: Ellen E., Augustus Henry, Charles Chandler, Matthew, Roger Wolcott, Eliza Woodbridge, Mary Ann "Marian", William Frederick, Robert Harper, James, Frances Ann.
(6) Ellen E. Griswold6 (Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
(6) Augustus Henry Griswold6 (Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 OCT 1789 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 29 DEC 1836 .
NotesAUGUSTUS was a ship's captain.
m. Eizabeth L. , b. 1795 , d. 12 MAR 1848 .

(8) Grace Card Selden8 (Lydia Marie Griswold7, Matthew Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 OCT 1865 Erie, Erie Co., Pennsylvania, d. .
m. Frederick Lincoln Chapin, b. 1863 Erie, Erie Co., Pennsylvania, d. 9 DEC 1913 .
(7) Matthew Griswold7 (Matthew Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 6 JUN 1833 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 19 MAY 1919 Erie, Erie Co., Pennsylvania.
NotesMATTHEW moved to Erie, Pennsylvania, in 1865 and formed a partnership with his cousins, John and Samuel Selden, "The Selden and Griswold Manufacturing Co. ", manufacturing iron goods. He bought out the Seldens in 1884. He was a member of the 53rd and 54th Congresses.
m. 8 JAN 1866 Sarah Lucy Olmstead, b. 18 MAY 1840 Ripley, Chautauqua Co., New York, d. 21 FEB 1871 Ripley, Chautauqua Co., New York.

NotesJOHN served in the Civil War.
(6) Robert Harper Griswold6 (Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1806 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 1882 .
NotesROBERT was a ship Captain.
m. Helen Maria Powers, b. 1820 , d. 1899 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesHELEN opened her home as a girls' finishing school, the Griswold Home School, in 1878, giving instruction in French, painting, drawing, and music.
4 children: Louise Augusta, Helen Adele "Adele", Robert Harper, Florence.
(7) Louise Augusta Griswold7 (Robert Harper Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 8 OCT 1841 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 12 APR 1896 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
NotesLOUISE was the organist for the First Congregational Church at Old Lyme for 40 years.
(7) Helen Adele "Adele" Griswold7 (Robert Harper Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 MAR 1844 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 27 FEB 1913 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
NotesHELEN and her sister, Florence, lived in the family home after their mother's death, taking in borders and selling plants and vegetables from their garden to make ends meet. In 1899 the artist, Henry Ward Ranger, came to board with them, and he encouraged other artists to stay there and to form an artist's colony at Old Lyme. Shortly after the colony was formed, Adele got tuberculosis and went to live in a sanitarium at Hartford, after which Florence ran the boarding house.
(7) Robert Harper Griswold7 (Robert Harper Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1847 , d. 21 SEP 1864 .
NotesROBERT died of dyptheheria at age 16.
(Medical):ROBERT died of Dyptheria at age 16.
(7) Florence Griswold7 (Robert Harper Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 DEC 1850 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 6 DEC 1937 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
NotesFLORENCE ran the family home as a boarding house for artists and an art gallery after her sister moved to a sanitarium. In 1921 the Lyme Art Association opened a gallery next to her home on land she gave them for this purpose. She was considered a patron of the American Impressionist movement. She became the first manager of the gallery, receiving a percentage of the sales. In 1936 a conservator was appointed for her and her property sold, but she retained life tenancy. The home is now th "Florence Griswold Museum.
(6) James Griswold6 (Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 31 DEC 1808 Old Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 16 JAN 1810 .
(6) Frances Ann Griswold6 (Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 JAN 1795 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 11 OCT 1818 Ebenezer Lane, b. 17 SEP 1793 Northampton, Hampshire Co., Massachusetts, d. 12 JUN 1866 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio.
Spouse NotesEBENEZER was Chief Justice of Ohio. Ebenezer and Frances were first cousins.
1 children: William Griswold.
(7) William Griswold Lane7 (Frances Ann Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 FEB 1824 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 28 OCT 1877 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio.

(8) Elizabeth Griswold Lane8 (William Griswold Lane7, Frances Ann Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 OCT 1851 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio, d. .
m. Charles Horace Moss, b. 15 DEC 1844 New Berlin, Chenango Co., New York, d. .
(8) Sarah Spencer Lane8 (William Griswold Lane7, Frances Ann Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 MAR 1853 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio, d. 19 JAN 1935 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
(8) Wolcott Griswold Lane8 (William Griswold Lane7, Frances Ann Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 JAN 1866 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio, d. 11 NOV 1956 .
NotesWOLCOTT graduated from Yale University with a degree in law in 1888. He was a lawyer and argued before the New York Surogate Court. He was one of the Executors of the will of William Augustus Spencer who died in the sinking of the Titanic in 1912, as well as executor for Williams brother, Lorrilard Spencer. His transcripts of the papers of Roger Griswold are in the Connecticut Historical Society.
(8) Charles Chandler Griswold Lane8 (William Griswold Lane7, Frances Ann Griswold6, Roger Griswold5, Ursula Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 DEC 1867 Sandusky, Erie Co., Ohio, d. 7 MAY 1896 ,, New York.
