m. 9 OCT 1888 Jane I. Robson, b. , d. .
(8) John Jackson Henry8 (Mary Elizabeth Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 SEP 1859 , d. .
m. 3 NOV 1885 Clara Reeves, b. , d. .
(8) Elizabeth Wolcott Henry8 (Mary Elizabeth Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 6 APR 1863 Germantown, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. .
m. 16 FEB 1887 Lewis Wynne Wister, b. 28 FEB 1864 Germantown, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania, d. .
(7) Julia Huntington Jackson7 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 JUL 1831 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 8 APR 1905 .
(7) Frederick Wolcott Jackson7 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 AUG 1833 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 14 JUN 1904 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
NotesFREDERICK studied at the Sheffield Scientific School at Yale University, graduating in 1852. He joined Norwood & Co. in New York City, and in 1855 went to work for New Jersey Railroad. He became General Superintendant of the United New Jersey Railroads, Pennsylvania Co..
m. 12 OCT 1859 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, Nannie Jane Nye, b. 5 AUG 1835 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 10 MAR 1905 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
9 children: Philip Nye, John Brinckerhoff, William Fessenden, Frederick Wolcott, Charles Huntington, Elizabeth Wolcott, Nina Fessenden, Oliver Wolcott, Martha Nye.
(8) Philip Nye Jackson8 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 SEP 1860 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 13 MAR 1911 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
NotesPHILIP graduated from Princeton University in 1880, and Columbia Law School. He worked for the Newark Power & Light Co..
m. 5 NOV 1884 Margaret Atlee, b. , d. 12 SEP 1934 .
(8) John Brinckerhoff Jackson8 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 AUG 1862 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
NotesJOHN attended the Naval Academy 1879-83. He served in the Navy, resigning in 1886. He studied law at New York University and was admitted to the bar in 1889. He joined the diplomatic corps in 1890 and in 1903 was appointed minister to Greece, Roumania, Serbia, Bulgaria and Montenegro. In 1907 he was transferred to Persia, and in 1909 to Cuba, and then to the Balkans.
m. 25 APR 1886 Florence A. Baird, b. , d. .
(8) William Fessenden Jackson8 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 NOV 1864 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
NotesWILLIAM graduated from Princeton University in 1885 and became a banker.
(8) Frederick Wolcott Jackson8 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 JUN 1867 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 2 SEP 1932 Lakeville, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
NotesFREDERICK graduated from Princeton University in 1887 and received a docturate from Columbia University in 1888 and graduated from Priceton Theological Seminary in 1891. He was a Presbyterian minister, and a member of the Board of Managers of the Americam Bible Society. He was a missionary to China 1892-94, representing the Society. He studied medicine at Bellvue Hospital 1894-95. He was pastor of the Scotch Presbyterian Church at Jersey City 1896-1900. He then did missionary work in North Carolin and studied in Germany. In 1906 he became an English professor at the German Theological Seminary at Bloomfield, New Jersey. He joined the Wolcott Society in 1930 as member #149, residing at Glen Ridge, New Jersey.
m. 27 JUN 1894 Savannah, Chatham Co., Georgia, Louise Gindrat Arnold, b. 23 OCT 1871 Newport, Newport Co., Rhode Island, d. 17 FEB 1928 Glenn Ridge, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(8) Charles Huntington Jackson8 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 NOV 1869 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 5 JUN 1911 Denver, Arapahoe Co., Colorado.
NotesCHARLES graduated from Princeton in 1890 and Columbia Law School in 1893, He was at Attorney at Newark until 1903, when he joined the Benefit Life Insurance Co.. He moved to Greeley, Colorado, in 1908 where he died of a heart attack.
(8) Elizabeth Wolcott Jackson8 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 JAN 1872 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
(8) Nina Fessenden Jackson8 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 JUN 1874 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 18 MAY 1907 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
m. 19 APR 1900 Neilson Abeel, b. 22 AUG 1872 , d. 18 MAY 1907 .
Spouse NotesNEILSON was a lawyer at Newark.
(8) Oliver Wolcott Jackson8 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 SEP 1876 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
NotesOLIVER graduated from Princeton University in 1898 and became a realator.
m. 6 APR 1904 Adele P. Carpenter, b. , d. .
(8) Martha Nye Jackson8 (Frederick Wolcott Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 NOV 1878 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 7 MAR 1951 .
m. 12 OCT 1906 Lewis Stewart, b. , d. 3 MAR 1908 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
Spouse NotesLEWIS graduated from Massachusetts Polytechnic and the Ecole ded Beaux Arts. He was an architect
(7) Joseph Cooke Jackson7 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 AUG 1835 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 22 MAY 1913 New York City, New York.
NotesJOSEPH graduated from Yale College in 1857. He received a LLB degree from Harvard University in 1860 and was admitted to practice law in New York City in 1860. He was commissioned Lt. Col. of the 6th New Jersey Volunteers in December 1862 for his gallant action at Fredericksburg, Virginia, December 11-15, 1862. He was brevetted Brigadier General, March 13, 1865. He was appointed U.S. Assistant District Attorney for the Southern District of New York by President Grant in 1870. After the war he was an attorney in New York City. He visited Tolland, Somerset, in 1903 and 1907, and joined the Wolcott Society in 1913 residing at New York City. In 1912 he privately published a 93 page book, "European and American Family of Wolcott". Some things said in that book were erronius.
m. 12 OCT 1864 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Katharine Perkins Day, b. 24 FEB 1837 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 25 NOV 1914 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
4 children: Joseph Cooke, John Day, Katharine Seymour, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott.
(8) Joseph Cooke Jackson8 (Joseph Cooke Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 AUG 1865 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 6 MAR 1946 Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
NotesJOSEPH graduated from Yale University in 1887.
m. 14 JUN 1900 Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, Mabel Goodsell, b. 29 APR 1872 , d. 11 APR 1955 Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(8) John Day Jackson8 (Joseph Cooke Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 SEP 1868 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 17 MAR 1961 New Haven, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
NotesJOHN graduated from Yale University in 1890 and was a journalist. He was owner and publisher of the New Haven Register.
m. 28 JUL 1909 Elgin, Kane Co., Illinois, Rose Marie Herrick, b. 25 MAR 1888 Dundee, Kane Co., Illinois, d. 9 FEB 1977 Hamden, New Haven Co., Connecticut.
(8) Katharine Seymour Jackson8 (Joseph Cooke Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 OCT 1871 New York City, New York, d. 1 JUN 1959 Purchase, Westchester Co., New York.
m. 4 DEC 1909 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Percy Hamilton Goodsell, b. 13 SEP 1876 New York City, New York, d. 28 MAY 1950 Purchase, Westchester Co., New York.
(8) Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott Jackson8 (Joseph Cooke Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 SEP 1875 Quoque, Suffolk Co., New York, d. 21 MAY 1933 New York City, New York.
m. 20 OCT 1909 New York City, New York, Martin Sheeler Watts, b. Baltimore, Baltimore Co., Maryland, d. 1933 New York City, New York.
(7) John Peter Jackson7 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 6 FEB 1837 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 17 DEC 1880 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
NotesJOHN graduated from Princeton College in 1856 and received a LLB degree from Harvard in 1858. He was an attorney at Newark, New Jersey. He was a member of the Newark City Council 1866-70, and was Speaker of the New Jersey Legislature 1862-63.
m. 1868 Clara Catlin Gregory, b. , d. 1936 .
5 children: Eliza Gregory, Laura Wolcott, Eliot Gregory, John Peter, Huntington Wolcott.
(8) Eliza Gregory Jackson8 (John Peter Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1869 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. .
m. FEB 1903 Deming Jarves, b. , d. .
(8) Laura Wolcott Jackson8 (John Peter Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1870 , d. .
m. 6 MAR 1909 Wilhelm A.F. Ekengren, b. ,, Sweden, d. 26 NOV 1920 Washington, District of Columbia.
Spouse NotesWILHELM was appointed Swedish Minister to the United States in March 1912, after serving six years as Secretary and Counselor at the American Embassy. He married Laura Wolcott Jackson while serving as Secretary.
(8) Eliot Gregory Jackson8 (John Peter Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUL 1872 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. San Francisco, San Francisco Co., California.
m. 1903 Margaret Grey, b. , d. .
(8) John Peter Jackson8 (John Peter Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 MAY 1878 , d. .
NotesJOHN graduated from the Naval Academy and served in the Navy during the Spanish American War.
(8) Huntington Wolcott Jackson8 (John Peter Jackson7, Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 17 APR 1880 , d. .
NotesHUNTINGTON graduated from Princeton University.
m. 18 FEB 1909 Shelby Converse, b. , d. .
(7) Hannah Wolcott Jackson7 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 APR 1839 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 24 AUG 1904 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(7) Huntington Wolcott Jackson7 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 JAN 1841 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 3 JAN 1901 ,, Illinois.
NotesHUNTINGTON entered the College of New Jersey in 1859, but left at the end of his junior year to join the army. In 1863 he was brevetted Lt. Colonel. He was badly wounded at Kenesaw Mountain. He graduated from Harvard Law school in 1865, and was admitted to the Bar in 1868. He practiced law in Newark and Chicago, and in 1888 he was president of the Chicago Bar Assn. He apparently never married. A bronze tablet to his memory was placed in the Marshall Field store in Chicago.
(7) Charles Henry Jackson7 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 MAY 1843 , d. 14 FEB 1844 .
(7) Henry Griswold Jackson7 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 MAR 1845 , d. 28 MAR 1846 .
(7) Schuyler Brinckerhoff Jackson7 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 JUN 1849 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 28 JUL 1915 Newark, Essex Co., New Jersey.
NotesSCHUYLER graduated from Yale College in 1871, and from Columbia Law School in 1873. In 1879 he was an alderman at Newark 1879-80 and a member of the New Jersey legislature 1878-79. He became Speaker of the General Assembly of New Jersey in 1879. He was a member of the Wolcott Society 1914-15, residing at Newark, New Jersey.
m. 27 FEB 1889 Angela Forbes, b. , d. .
(6) Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6 (Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 AUG 1808 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 13 APR 1883 Astoria, Queens Co., New York.
NotesFREDERICK was a merchant in New York City. In 1860 he was living at Newtown, Queens, with Sarah E., Elizabeth H., Alice, Frederick, and Gardner H. He was much interested in family history, and hired H. G. Somerby to research the Wolcott family in England. It was largely through his interest and using his papers that Samuel Wolcott compiled the "Wolcott Memorial", the first published genealogy of the family. The book was privately distributed in 1886. Frederick owned the Oliver Wolcott house at Litchfield.
m. 12 JUN 1838 ,, New York, Abby Woolsey Howland, b. 11 NOV 1817 New York City, New York, d. 14 JUN 1852 Astoria, Queens Co., New York.
Spouse NotesABBY was a descendant of John Howland who came to America on the Mayflower.
6 children: Elizabeth Huntington, Alice, Frederick Henry, Gardiner Howland, Oliver Huntington, Abby Howland.
(7) Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1840 Nyack, Rockland Co., New York, d. .
m. 20 NOV 1861 New York City, New York, Stephen L. Merchant, b. 1838 ,, Georgia, d. .
Spouse NotesStephen was a merchant in New York City. He and his wife lived with her father in 1880.
1 children: Huntington Wolcott.
(8) Huntington Wolcott Merchant8 (Elizabeth Huntington Wolcott7, Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 JUN 1869 New York City, New York, d. .
m. Mary Cornelia Tallmadge, b. Chicago, Cook Co., Illinois, d. .
(7) Alice Wolcott7 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1843 New York City, New York, d. 1927 .
(7) Frederick Henry Wolcott7 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 30 OCT 1845 New York City, New York, d. 1885 .
(7) Gardiner Howland Wolcott7 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 AUG 1848 New York City, New York, d. 5 NOV 1881 .
NotesGARDINER was a merchant, and travelled to Europe in 1880.
(7) Oliver Huntington Wolcott7 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 OCT 1850 New York City, New York, d. 15 MAY 1852 New York City, New York.
(7) Abby Howland Wolcott7 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1852 , d. 22 JUN 1852 .
(6) Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6 (Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 19 AUG 1808 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 13 APR 1883 Astoria, Queens Co., New York.
NotesFREDERICK was a merchant in New York City. In 1860 he was living at Newtown, Queens, with Sarah E., Elizabeth H., Alice, Frederick, and Gardner H. He was much interested in family history, and hired H. G. Somerby to research the Wolcott family in England. It was largely through his interest and using his papers that Samuel Wolcott compiled the "Wolcott Memorial", the first published genealogy of the family. The book was privately distributed in 1886. Frederick owned the Oliver Wolcott house at Litchfield.
m. 18 JAN 1855 Plattsburgh, Clinton Co., New York, Sarah Elizabeth Merchant, b. 22 OCT 1822 Plattsburgh, Clinton Co., New York, d. 1907 .
3 children: Charles Merchant, Abby Howland, Alice.
(7) Charles Merchant Wolcott7 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 NOV 1855 New York City, New York, d. 3 APR 1858 .
(7) Abby Howland Wolcott7 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1863 New York City, New York, d. .
(7) Alice Wolcott7 (Frederick Henry "Fred" Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1865 New York City, New York, d. Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
NotesALICE never married. She owned and lived in the Oliver Wolcott house at Litchfield. In 1922 she sold it to her niece, Alice Sherman.
(6) Laura Maria Wolcott6 (Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 AUG 1811 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 7 FEB 1892 .
NotesLAURA went to live with her maternal grandparents at Norwich, Connecticut, shortly after her father remarried. She lived with them for nine years. In 1825 she was sent to Sarah Pierce's school for girls at Litchfield. In 1880, Laura was at Newburgh, New York, with daughters, Laura M., Frances W., Mary W., and Cornelia W. Wolcott
m. 11 MAR 1831 Newburgh, Orange Co., New York, Robert Gosman Rankin, b. 29 JUN 1806 New York City, New York, d. 6 MAR 1875 Newburgh, Orange Co., New York.
Spouse NotesROBERT was raised by a friend of his father who resided at Ulster, New York. He graduated from Yale College in 1826, worked in a law office in New York City for one year, and then attended the Tapping Reeve Law School at Litchfield, Connecticut. He became a lawyer in 1829, marrying 2 years later Laura Wolcott who he met while studying law at Litchfield. He worked for various railroads and manufacturers. Robert was an Elder of the Presbyterian Church, and was elected a Regent of The University of the State of New York in 1846. In 1852 he moved to Astoria, Long Island, where he was a consulting engineer. He became president of the Mexican Mail Company in 1853, and later managed a coal mining company. He moved to Newburgh, New York, in 1863 because of poor health.
12 children: Frederick Wolcott, Huntington Wolcott, Ann, Henry, Robert Gosman, Laura Maria, Charles Chauncey Wolcott, Katherine Almedea, Frances Wolcott, Francis Huntington, Mary Wolcott, Cornelia W. "Nellie".
(7) Frederick Wolcott Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 JUN 1832 , d. 9 DEC 1881 .
NotesFREDERICK graduated from Williams College in 1849.
(7) Huntington Wolcott Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 SEP 1834 , d. 21 AUG 1840 .
(7) Ann Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 FEB 1834 , d. .
m. 15 JUN 1859 Charles J. Collins, b. , d. .
Spouse NotesCHARLES was a presbyterian minister at Lacawana.
(7) Henry Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 OCT 1835 ,, New York, d. 5 SEP 1836 .
(7) Robert Gosman Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 22 MAR 1837 ,, New York, d. 4 JUN 1838 .
NotesROBERT served in the Union Army during the Civil War.
(7) Laura Maria Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 JUN 1838 ,, New York, d. .
(7) Charles Chauncey Wolcott Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 DEC 1840 , d. .
(7) Katherine Almedea Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 SEP 1843 , d. 6 FEB 1893 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
m. 15 MAR 1865 Newburgh, Orange Co., New York, George Adams Boyce, b. 13 JUN 1840 New York City, New York, d. 8 APR 1917 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
Spouse NotesGEORGE was a comission and produce merchant in partnership with W. S. Hartshorne at New York City.
4 children: Gertrude Huntington, John, George Adams, Robert Rankin.
(8) Gertrude Huntington Boyce8 (Katherine Almedea Rankin7, Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 FEB 1869 Brooklyn, Kings Co., New York, d. 10 JUN 1962 .
m. 12 NOV 1891 Arthur Cushman McGiffert, b. 4 MAR 1861 Sauquoit, Oneida Co., New York, d. 25 FEB 1933 .
Spouse NotesARTHUR graduated from Western Reserve College in 1882 and from Union Theological Seminary in 1885, and was ordained in the Presbyterian Church. He then studied in Europe and received a Doctor of Philosophy from the University of Marburg in 1888. He was a teacher and professor at Lane Theological Seminary 1888-1893, and then was a professor at Union Theological Seminary. Because of criticism of his controversial writings, he left the Presbyterian church and was ordained in the Congregational Church.
(8) John Boyce8 (Katherine Almedea Rankin7, Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 21 FEB 1872 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 22 JUL 1872 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(8) George Adams Boyce8 (Katherine Almedea Rankin7, Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 28 OCT 1873 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 16 FEB 1874 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(8) Robert Rankin Boyce8 (Katherine Almedea Rankin7, Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 18 OCT 1874 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 12 SEP 1949 Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
m. 2 NOV 1903 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, Caroline Harrison "Caro" Ward, b. 30 JAN 1877 East Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey, d. 12 AUG 1952 Orange, Essex Co., New Jersey.
(7) Frances Wolcott Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 SEP 1845 ,, New York, d. .
NotesFRANCIS graduated fron New York University in 1869. He founded the Austrian Red Cross.
(7) Francis Huntington Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 SEP 1845 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 9 NOV 1896 Newport, Newport Co., Rhode Island.
NotesFRANCIS graduated from the Medical Department of New York University in 1869. He studied in Vienna for a year, and then went to Berlin where he was given an appointment as Acting Assistant Surgeon in the Prussian Army, and then Acting Surgeon. On returning to America he was given the steel medal of thanks from the Prussinan government. He began practice in New York City in 1871. In 1876 he moved to Newport and joined practice with Dr. Austin Sands who died the following year. He was a founder and President of the Newport Medical Society, and attending physician at the Newport Hospital. He was a frequent contributor to medical journals.
m. 11 NOV 1879 Grace Voorhis, b. , d. .
(7) Mary Wolcott Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 MAY 1848 ,, New York, d. .
(7) Cornelia W. "Nellie" Rankin7 (Laura Maria Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 AUG 1850 ,, New York, d. .
(5) Frederick Wolcott5 (Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 NOV 1767 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 28 MAY 1837 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
NotesFREDERICK graduated from Yale College in 1786, delivering the the salutatorian oration in Latin. He was Clerk of the Court of Common Pleas in 1793, and clerk of the Superior Court at Litchfield in 1798. In 1796 he was appointed Judge of Probate. He inherited his parents home on South Street at Litchfield in 1797. His black servant, Hebe Williams died at Litchfield in 1803. Frederick was elected as Representative to the Connecticut General Assembly in 1808, and in 1810 was elected to the State Senate, an office that he held until 1823. He was a partner with his brother, Oliver, in the development of the woolen mills at a place that became known as Wolcottville. He and his brother imported cattle from England and sheep from Spain, and worked to improve American breeds of cattle and sheep. During the Revolutionary War he provided public service in Connecticut. He and his wife sold 200 acres of land at Norwalk, Ohio in 1822, part of the estate of her first husband, Amos Cook.
m. 21 JUN 1815 Danbury, Fairfield Co., Connecticut, Sarah Worthington "Sally" Goodrich, b. 7 AUG 1785 Berlin, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 14 SEP 1842 .
Spouse NotesSARAH was heir of her husband, Amos Cooke, to 100 acres of land near Norwalk, Huron Co., Ohio, which she and her husband, Frederick Wolcott, sold to Harvey Webb in 1822.
4 children: Charles Moseley, Chauncey Goodrich, Henry Griswold, Mary Frances.
(6) Charles Moseley Wolcott6 (Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 NOV 1816 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 20 NOV 1889 New York City, New York.
NotesCHARLES was a merchant. His home on the eastern bank of the Hudson River, near Fishkill Landing, was called "Roseneath". He was at Fishkill in 1860, with wife, Catherine, and children, Henry, Catherine, and Ann. In 1863 he made a gift of 6 acres of land to St. Anna's Episcopal Church at Fishkill. C. M. Wolcott was at Fishkill in 1870, when the census says he was born in Massachusetts. With him was his wife, Catherine, and his three children. In 1880, he was a retired merchant, living at Matteawan, Dutchess Co., New York.
m. 1 NOV 1843 Roxbury, Suffolk Co., Massachusetts, Mary Elizabeth Goodrich, b. 26 OCT 1818 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 13 NOV 1845 Philadelphia, Philadelphia Co., Pennsylvania.
1 children: Frederick.
(7) Frederick Wolcott7 (Charles Moseley Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 DEC 1844 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 25 MAR 1846 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
(6) Charles Moseley Wolcott6 (Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 20 NOV 1816 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 20 NOV 1889 New York City, New York.
NotesCHARLES was a merchant. His home on the eastern bank of the Hudson River, near Fishkill Landing, was called "Roseneath". He was at Fishkill in 1860, with wife, Catherine, and children, Henry, Catherine, and Ann. In 1863 he made a gift of 6 acres of land to St. Anna's Episcopal Church at Fishkill. C. M. Wolcott was at Fishkill in 1870, when the census says he was born in Massachusetts. With him was his wife, Catherine, and his three children. In 1880, he was a retired merchant, living at Matteawan, Dutchess Co., New York.
m. 26 NOV 1849 New York City, New York, Catharine Almandia Rankin, b. 6 JAN 1817 New York City, New York, d. 24 JUN 1889 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York.
Spouse NotesCATHERINE was New York State Regent for the D.A.R..
3 children: Henry Goodrich, Katharine Rankin, Annette Rankin.
(7) Henry Goodrich Wolcott7 (Charles Moseley Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 JUL 1853 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 2 APR 1906 Genoa,, Italy.
NotesHENRY graduated from Yale with a Ph.B. in 1873, and from Columbia College, LLB, in 1877. In 1892 he was a lawyer at Fishkill with Julia L., Oliver, Charles W., Elizabeth, and Katherine Wolcott. He was a member of the New York Bar, a lawyer, U.S. Commissioner, and Lt. Col. in the 21st Regiment, New York Guards. He resided at Roseneath, Fishkill-on-the-Hudson, but practiced law at Matteawan, a neighboring village.
m. 22 MAY 1879 New York City, New York, Julia Sterling Hutchins, b. 17 JUL 1855 New York City, New York, d. 15 FEB 1930 Red Bank, Monmouth Co., New Jersey.
Spouse NotesJULIA bought a large home on the Shrewsbury River at Red Bank in 1928. She was DAR member #10156.
6 children: Oliver, Charles Moseley, Henry Goodrich, Elizabeth Ellsworth, Katharine Rankin, Julia Hutchins.
(8) Oliver Wolcott8 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott7, Charles Moseley Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 14 MAR 1880 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 28 DEC 1893 .
(8) Charles Moseley Wolcott8 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott7, Charles Moseley Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 AUG 1882 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. .
NotesCHARLES was a real estate agent at Red Bank, New Jersey, in 1923, with Albertha and David Wolcott. He was there in 1941 when he joined the Wolcott Society.
m. 9 FEB 1929 Alberta Albrecht, b. , d. .
(8) Henry Goodrich Wolcott8 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott7, Charles Moseley Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 2 MAR 1884 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 10 AUG 1885 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York.
(8) Elizabeth Ellsworth Wolcott8 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott7, Charles Moseley Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 8 SEP 1886 , d. .
NotesELIZABETH was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914. She was a page at the D.A.R. National Congress in 1925.
m. JUN 1925 Red Bank, Monmouth Co., New Jersey, Sayre, b. , d. .
(8) Katharine Rankin Wolcott8 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott7, Charles Moseley Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 AUG 1888 , d. 4 DEC 1893 .
(8) Julia Hutchins Wolcott8 (Henry Goodrich Wolcott7, Charles Moseley Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 JUL 1892 , d. .
(7) Katharine Rankin Wolcott7 (Charles Moseley Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 APR 1855 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 2 NOV 1941 Beacon, Dutchess Co., New York.
NotesKATHERINE was President of the National Society of Colonial Dames, and Regent of the Daughters of the American Revolution. She was a member of the Wolcott Society in 1914, co-vice president for New York, and a member of the Historical Committee.
m. 8 APR 1896 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, Samuel Verplanck, b. 20 JUL 1840 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. 15 DEC 1911 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York.
Spouse NotesSAMUEL Verplanck of Matteawan was one of the wealthiest men in Dutchess County, and probably its wealthiest land owners. He and his wife and Mrs, Rankin of Newburg were shot while out driving near Newburg 12 Aug. 1901. It was found to be an accident by someone squirrel hunting.
(7) Annette Rankin Wolcott7 (Charles Moseley Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 29 JUN 1857 Fishkill, Dutchess Co., New York, d. .
(6) Chauncey Goodrich Wolcott6 (Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 MAR 1819 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 28 OCT 1820 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut.
(6) Henry Griswold Wolcott6 (Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 NOV 1820 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. 8 MAY 1852 New York City, New York.
NotesHENRY received his business training in Boston as apprentice to his brother, Joshua. He went to China as a merchant in 1843, financed by his brother and his brother's partner, Abbott Lawrence. Henry was in partnership with Edward G. Bates and later his son, Edward W. Bates. Edward, Sr., is buried at Macau, China, where the stone reads" Edward G. Bates of the firm Wolcott, Bates & Co. of Shanghai Ltd., 1841 out of New York". The company was listed in directories 1842-1852. Henry was the first U.S. Consul at Shanghai, appointed as acting consul in 1846. The British objected to his flying the American flag in their area, and after his departure in 1847 when a new consulate was established outside British jurisdiction. He returned to the United States due to poor health caused my malaria contracted in China. He went to Germany for the spas, but when this failed to help, he returned to New York and died at his brother's home.
(6) Mary Frances Wolcott6 (Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 9 JUL 1823 Litchfield, Litchfield Co., Connecticut, d. .
NotesMARY lived at Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, in 1880, age 56, with children Theodore 31, Cornelia 26, Bessie 23, all born Massachusetts, Harriet 19 born Pennsylvania, and two Irish servants.
m. 4 FEB 1845 Theodore Frothingham, b. , d. .
5 children: Theodore, Mary Goodrich, Cornelia, Bessie, Harriet.
(7) Theodore Frothingham7 (Mary Frances Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1849 ,, Massachusetts, d. .
NotesTHEODORE graduated from Harvard University in 1870. In 1880 he was a ship broker at Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
(7) Mary Goodrich Frothingham7 (Mary Frances Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. ABT 1850 , d. .
m. Charles Brinley, b. , d. .
1 children: Alice,
(8) Alice Brinley8 (Mary Goodrich Frothingham7, Mary Frances Wolcott6, Frederick Wolcott5, Oliver Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. , d. .
NotesALICE purchased the Oliver Wolcott house at Litchfield from her cousin Alice Wolcott in 1922. She was living there in the 1960s.
m. King, b. , d. .

(4) Mariann Wolcott4 (Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 JAN 1729 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1 JUL 1798 Chaplin, Windham Co., Connecticut.
m. 5 DEC 1758 Pomfret, Windham Co., Connecticut, Thomas Williams, b. 6 MAY 1725 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 3 APR 1778 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut.
3 children: Roger, Roger Wolcott, Mariann.
(5) Roger Williams5 (Mariann Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 AUG 1761 ,, Connecticut, d. 22 AUG 1761 ,, Connecticut.
(5) Roger Wolcott Williams5 (Mariann Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 12 AUG 1764 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 1 OCT 1821 .
NotesROGER lived at Brooklyn, Connecticut.
m. 5 APR 1794 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, Mary "Polly" Scarborough, b. JAN 1775 Of Brooklyn,, Connecticut, d. 6 DEC 1820 .
7 children: Herbert, Frances, Edward, Cecilia, Godfrey, Mariann Noyes, Ursula.
(6) Herbert Williams6 (Roger Wolcott Williams5, Mariann Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 27 MAY 1795 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 4 APR 1867 Michigan City, La Porte Co., Indiana.
NotesHERBERT moved his family to LaPorte, Indiana, in 1836. In 1850 they were living in Michigan City, Indiana. They were abolitionists, and their home was used as a station on the "underground railroad".
m. 19 AUG 1822 Lucy Bigelow, b. 11 APR 1797 New Braintree, Worcester Co., Massachusetts, d. .
5 children: Wolcott Bigelow, Amelia Sumner, Amelia Sumner, Lucy Maria, Ellen Dickinson.
(7) Wolcott Bigelow Williams7 (Herbert Williams6, Roger Wolcott Williams5, Mariann Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 AUG 1823 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 31 AUG 1913 Charlotte, Eaton Co., Michigan.
NotesWOLCOTT attended Oberlin College in 1844-9, receiving a AB degree in 1850, AM degree in 1853, and a DD from Olivet College in 1898. He was a Congregational minister and a "conductor" on the "Underground Railroad" in Missouri, helping slaves escape from the South. He moved to Michigan where he preached at the First Congregational Church of Charlotte. He was the author of "The Past and Present of Eaton County, Michigan", published in 1887, and "Christian and Secular Education", published 1894.
m. 5 OCT 1853 Mary Augusta Thompson, b. , d. .
4 children: Alice I., Edith Burr, Sarah N., Herbert M..

(6) Frances Williams6 (Roger Wolcott Williams5, Mariann Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 6 JUN 1797 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 19 APR 1816 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut.

(6) Cecilia Williams6 (Roger Wolcott Williams5, Mariann Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 OCT 1801 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, d. 13 MAR 1837 Chaplin, Windham Co., Connecticut.
m. 27 JUN 1827 Charles Brooks, b. 30 OCT 1795 Medford, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts, d. 7 JUL 1872 Medford, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts.
Spouse NotesCHARLES was a graduate of Harvard College, and was pastor of the 3rd Congregational Church at Hingham, Massachusetts until 1839, when he became Professor of Natural History at the University of New York.
3 children: Elizabeth Alurre, Charles John, Charles Wolcott.
(7) Elizabeth Alurre Brooks7 (Cecilia Williams6, Roger Wolcott Williams5, Mariann Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 APR 1828 Hingham, Plymouth Co., Massachusetts, d. 5 MAR 1869 Medford, Middlesex Co., Massachusetts.
NotesELIZABETH died unmarried.
(7) Charles John Brooks7 (Cecilia Williams6, Roger Wolcott Williams5, Mariann Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 16 APR 1832 Hingham, Plymouth Co., Massachusetts, d. 8 JUL 1833 Hingham, Plymouth Co., Massachusetts.
(7) Charles Wolcott Brooks7 (Cecilia Williams6, Roger Wolcott Williams5, Mariann Wolcott4, Sarah Drake3, Job Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 OCT 1833 Hingham, Plymouth Co., Massachusetts, d. 17 AUG 1885 Napa, Napa Co., California.
NotesCHARLES was Japanese consul in San Francisco, California, and author of several books, including: "Report on Japanese Vessels Wrecked in the North Pacific", and "Origin of the Chinese Race".

m. 19 NOV 1789 Brooklyn, Windham Co., Connecticut, John Noyes, b. 1757 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut, d. 11 AUG 1808 Lyme, New London Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesJOHN was a Surgeon's Mate in the 4th Massachusetts Inf. Regt in 1777, Surgeon in the 1st Connecticut Inf. Regt. in 1779, and the 4th Connecticut Inf. Regt. 1781 to 1788, and in Swift's Connecticut Regt. 1778 to 1783.

6 children: Esther, Dorothy Lamb, Elizabeth, Mary, Susanna, Theophilus.
(5) Esther Woodbridge5 (Elizabeth Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 MAY 1743 , d. .
(5) Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge5 (Elizabeth Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 NOV 1745 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 1792 .
m. Thomas Phelps, b. 17 JUL 1741 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 28 FEB 1789 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut.
Spouse NotesTHOMAS enlisted 4 March 1775, as Sgt. in Capt. Abel Pettibone's Co., of Simsbury, and was discharged 31 October 1775. He re-enlisted and joined Baldwin's Artificers, and in 1777 received his commission as 2nd Lt. in Capt. James Wilcox's Co., Col. Jeduthan Baldwin's Regt. of Artificers, 24 July 1777. He served under Generals Washington, Putnam, Heath and Greene, and in 1780 was engaged in rebuilding the block house at Newgate Prison. He was a great admirer of Gen. Greene, and his fourth chlld was named after him.
4 children: William Haynes "Billy", George Augustus, Thomas Woodbridge, Anson Green.

(6) Anson Green Phelps6 (Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge5, Elizabeth Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 24 MAR 1781 Simsbury, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 30 NOV 1853 New York City, New York.
NotesANSON was the founder of the firm of Phelps, Dodge & Company in New York City.
m. 26 OCT 1806 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, Olive Eggleston, b. 30 MAR 1785 Middletown, Middlesex Co., Connecticut, d. 24 APR 1859 New York City, New York.
8 children: Elizabeth Woodbridge, Melissa, Caroline Olivia, Caroline, Harriet N., Anson Green, Olivia Egleston, Lydia Ann.

(8) D. Willis James8 (Elizabeth Woodbridge Phelps7, Anson Green Phelps6, Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge5, Elizabeth Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 APR 1832 , d. .

(8) Olivia P. James8 (Elizabeth Woodbridge Phelps7, Anson Green Phelps6, Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge5, Elizabeth Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 13 MAY 1836 , d. .
m. Robert Hoe, b. , d. .
(7) Melissa Phelps7 (Anson Green Phelps6, Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge5, Elizabeth Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 3 MAR 1809 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. .
m. 24 JUN 1828 New York City, New York, William Earle Dodge, b. 4 SEP 1805 Hartford, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 9 FEB 1883 New York City, New York.
Spouse NotesWILLIAM was the junior partner of the firm of Phelps, Dodge & Co., Cliff street, organized by his father-in-law, Anson Green Phelps, and at the death of Mr. Phelps in 1853, William became the head and manager of the noted house. Under his adminsitration it sustained the character and reputation established for it by its founder. He was also representative for the eighth district in the 39th Congress.
9 children: William Earle, Anson Green Phelps, David Stuart, Charles Cleveland, Norman White, George Eggleston, Arthur Murray, Sarah Olivia, Melissa Phelps.
(8) William Earle Dodge8 (Melissa Phelps7, Anson Green Phelps6, Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge5, Elizabeth Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 15 FEB 1832 New York City, New York, d. .
m. 5 APR 1854 New York City, New York, Sarah T. Hoadly, b. , d. .
(8) Anson Green Phelps Dodge8 (Melissa Phelps7, Anson Green Phelps6, Dorothy Lamb Woodbridge5, Elizabeth Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 AUG 1834 New York City, New York, d. .

(6) Horace Hooker6 (Mary Chaffee5, Lydia Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 5 JUL 1794 Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 3 NOV 1865 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
NotesHORACE came to Carthage, New York, from Windsor, Connecticut, in 1821, and was engaged in comercial ventures. Carthage became part of Rochester.
m. 3 SEP 1822 , Ontario Co., New York, Helen Wolcott, b. 9 MAR 1794 East Windsor, Hartford Co., Connecticut, d. 4 APR 1840 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.
Spouse NotesHELEN attended Mrs. Royce's School for Girls at Hartford, as did her cousin, Ursula Wolcott.
8 children: Julia Wolcott, Henry Edward, Frances, James Wolcott, John Chaffee, Charles M., Thomas, Horace B..
(7) Julia Wolcott Hooker7 (Horace Hooker6, Mary Chaffee5, Lydia Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 11 APR 1823 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. .
m. 12 JUL 1844 Josiah Wolcott Bissell, b. 3 MAY 1818 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. .
Spouse NotesJOSIAH was engaged before the Civil War in banking, and in architectural and engineering work. During the war he was colonel of an engineer regiment attached to Gen. Pope's army, and superintended the construction of the canal that enabled the national gunboats to approach the confederate works on Island No. 10, in the Mississippi River.
6 children: Josiah Wolcott, Willard Parker, Helen Wolcott, Edward Hooker, Francis, George Perkins.
(8) Josiah Wolcott Bissell8 (Julia Wolcott Hooker7, Horace Hooker6, Mary Chaffee5, Lydia Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 1 JUN 1845 , d. .
(8) Willard Parker Bissell8 (Julia Wolcott Hooker7, Horace Hooker6, Mary Chaffee5, Lydia Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 26 AUG 1847 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 19 AUG 1878 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York.

NotesJAMES was a Lt. in the 1st Regiment Missoui Engineers during the Civil War. He committed suicide by hanging himself.

(7) Horace B. Hooker7 (Horace Hooker6, Mary Chaffee5, Lydia Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 7 DEC 1837 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 1914 .
NotesHORACE was a Lt. and acting Capt. in the 1st Regiment Missouri Engineers during the Civil War.
m. 14 NOV 1861 Susan Pamelia Huntington, b. 18 AUG 1841 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 1928 .
Spouse NotesSUSAN's biography was published in 1952 as "Susan Huntington Hooker, a Biography", by Kenneth Ward Hooker. Her letters and family papers are at the University of Rochester.
10 children: Albert Huntington, , Margaret Huntington, Elon Huntington, , Harry Mix, Paul, Horace Willard, Jeamette, Thomas.
(8) Albert Huntington Hooker8 (Horace B. Hooker7, Horace Hooker6, Mary Chaffee5, Lydia Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 NOV 1865 , d. 1936 .
NotesALBERT was a chemist.

(8) Margaret Huntington Hooker8 (Horace B. Hooker7, Horace Hooker6, Mary Chaffee5, Lydia Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 10 JUN 1868 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 1936 .
NotesMARGARET was an artist and a teacher.
(8) Elon Huntington Hooker8 (Horace B. Hooker7, Horace Hooker6, Mary Chaffee5, Lydia Griswold4, Samuel Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 23 NOV 1869 Rochester, Monroe Co., New York, d. 1938 .
NotesELON was a chemist, hydrodynamic engineer, and founder of the Hooker Electrochemical Co., founded in 1909. He was a candidate for the Republican nomination for Governor of New York in 1920.

NotesALEXANDER was educated privately by his uncle Roger Viets, a priest, and was ordained a priest in 1795. He was consecrated Bishop of the Eastern Diocese, covering all New England except Connecticut, 29 May 1811 in Trinity Church, New York City, and was presiding bishop 1836-1843.

NotesCASIMER was a landscape artist. He moved to New York in 1850 and exhibited at the Academy of Design in 1857, and was a member of the Academy in 1867. He lived and painted in Rome 1872-1886.

(7) Permelia Demaranville7 (Lydia Cleveland6, Azubah Smith5, Azubah Gunn4, Hester Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 4 JUN 1805 Fair Haven, Rutland Co., Vermont, d. 27 AUG 1840 Fair Haven, Rutland Co., Vermont.
m. 16 JUL 1826 Simeon Cobb, b. 1 APR 1805 Londenderry, Windham Co., Vermont, d. 5 AUG 1847 Fair Haven, Rutland Co., Vermont.
4 children: Ira, Caroline, Ellen, Martha.
(8) Ira Cobb8 (Permelia Demaranville7, Lydia Cleveland6, Azubah Smith5, Azubah Gunn4, Hester Griswold3, Hester "Esther" Drake2, Mary Wolcott1), b. 25 APR 1828 Troy, Rensselaer Co., New York, d. 2 AUG 1899 Fairfield, Wayne Co., Illinois.
m. Lydia Demaranville, b. 24 JUN 1836 Warsaw, Wyoming Co., New York, d. 4 NOV 1895 Correctionville, Woodbury Co., Iowa.
